description: Caramelized apple and crème brûlée flavors make for a heady richness in this wine. It finds its balance on the midpalate, where concentrated, silky waves of flavor move to a settling mineral intensity on the finish.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Strata Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a floral, concentrated white wine. The entry of lush crème brûlée and fig flavors are met by persistent honeysuckle and toasted oak tones.
title: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This medium-bodied wine is subtle on the nose, but opens up on the palate to rich fruit and spice flavors that coat the tongue. It is balanced toward the soft side, but with underling acidity to balance the richness.
title: Matchbook 2017 Estate Bottled Old Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: This is wine well worth stockpiling, such a good deal it is for the price. Hearty creamy ripeness is balanced and complemented by bold robust stone fruit, baked apple and a lingering thread of stony mineral.
title: Olema 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Oaky and a touch reduced, this wine offers a grip of texture and rich, round concentration. Baked apple and pear flavors are seasoned in tones of vanilla and butterscotch.
title: Kunde 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Dark-golden color gives way to a rich, rounded exploration of baked apple, nutmeg and toasted oak in this well-made vineyard-designate. The creamier, concentrated tones are given a lift of freshness from persistent acidity.
title: B Cellars 2016 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This white offers tremendous value, being bright, floral and fruity with a touch of restraint. Integrated ripeness and oak are etched in apple, pear and nutmeg, with just enough acidity to keep a level of freshness through the finish.
title: Stags' Leap Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a new offering from the producer-a lush expression that offers bold flavors and texture. With complementary oak, it offers rich layers of crème brûlée, caramel and apple, all dusted in nutmeg.
title: Hess Collection 2016 Panthera Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a well-made, full-bodied white that delivers honeyed flavors of salted pretzel and toasted oak. The bolder richer elements are complemented by bright bursts of orange blossom, grapefruit and lemon pith.
title: Buena Vista 2016 Jovita's Selection Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Clean aromas of toast, oak, butter and nectarine cream make for a strong showing of a Paso Robles Chardonnay. There is great grip to the palate right away, with flavors of lime and apple skin leading into a toasted oak finish.
title: Robert Hall 2016 Cavern Select Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Dark gold in color, this wine takes on a heady bouquet of honey, graham cracker, vanilla and crème brûlée. Hearty, full bodied and fleshy, its fruit-forward character is defined by flavors of pineapple and mango.
title: Landmark 2016 Damaris Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine offers a richness of caramelized oak and toffee that takes on an intensity in the midpalate. It settles into a more balanced presentation of apple, pear and melon with a lushness on the finish.
title: Longboard 2016 Rochioli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A good sense of concentration and balance in this medium-bodied wine give it an appetizing appeal. Fresh apple and pear aromas are lightly shaded with baking spices, and the flavors follow with plenty of fruit, good acidity and a light tang on the finish.
title: FEL 2017 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Entirely stainless-steel fermented, this is an impressive estate wine, highly aromatic in honeysuckle. Structured and fleshy on the midpalate, it has full-bodied ripeness and a concentration of rich white-peach and apricot flavor.
title: Hess Collection 2016 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Walnut and toasted oak aromas meet with poached and roasted apples on the nose. Flavors of sliced yellow pear and honeysuckle sit atop a rocky mineral note on the palate.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2016 Winemaker Series Heritage Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Thirst quenching in lemon, anise and wet stone, this is a steely, focused white that will appeal to fans of the unoaked style. It finishes on a lingering baked-bread tone.
designation: Teresa's Unoaked Estate Grown Estate Bottled
title: Balletto 2017 Teresa's Unoaked Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in an austere style, this has a backbone of tannin and power that builds on the midpalate, with the oak prominent and supportive. Meyer lemon and tangerine flavors are seasoned in touches of nutmeg and ginger, making for a balanced experience of fruit and spice.
designation: Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled
title: Balletto 2015 Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tightly wound on the nose, this clonal combo offers citrusy aromas of grapefruit rind and sharp apple flesh on the nose. The palate is wrapped in a chalky, tight texture, revealing flavors of Anjou pear and Pink Lady apple.
title: Wrath 2016 3 Clone Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A hint of flowers in the aroma of this rich and full-bodied wine gives way to ripe fig, pear and honey flavors on the palate. It's so ripe that it verges on sweetness, and has an opulent, viscous texture that helps the honeyed character cling to the sides of the mouth for a lingering finish.
title: Wood Family Vineyards 2017 Para Mas Amigas Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: This is a beautifully made wine, crispy in mineral elements and lovely layers of fig, Meyer lemon, tangerine and pear. Medium bodied, it holds its fruit and acidity well, with gritty layers of texture from start to finish.
title: Peter Paul Wines 2016 Live Free or Die Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is well made and big in style: a full-bodied, soft and round white offering an intensity of baked pineapple and mango. The spice component complements the bolder fruit and substantial oak, finishing in spicy nutmeg.
title: Frank Family 2016 Beckstoffer Carneros Lake Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a broad-shouldered, richly unctuous white despite its un-oaked approach. Spicy ginger, ripe mango and pear are aligned with a lasting taste of caramel.
title: Pellet Estate 2016 Sun Chase Vineyard Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Made in small amounts, this white worth seeking. It's crunchy in green apple and quince, with a complementary cradling of caramel oak. The rich body weight is buoyed by bright acidity.
title: Chenoweth 2017 Bootlegger's Hill Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: A reduced oaky entry leads to edgy citrus-driven acidity and a high-strung, stony briny mineral character that beguiles. Green apple, quince and Meyer lemon offer subtle fruit elements that rise up to the overall earthiness.
title: Brick & Mortar 2016 Cougar Rock Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Intensely textured and concentrated in fruit, this is marked by a depth of mango and pineapple with generous oak imparting toffee and caramel. It finds its balance midpalate with supportive acidity that lasts throughout a long finish.
title: La Follette 2016 Lorenzo Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Up-front oak gives way to a brightness of Meyer lemon in this ultimately medium-bodied structured white. Briny salty mineral elements pique a lusher midpalate of pineapple, fig and nutmeg, contrasting well to offer memorable complexity.
title: Cuvaison 2016 Kite Tail Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Smoked hazelnut and rich oak aromas are cut by whiffs of lemon rind, citrus spray, chalk and Asian pear on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate offers both sharp citrus and rounded apple flavors.
title: Sanford 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Aromatically, vanilla oak supports a medium-bodied ripeness of baked pineapple and lemon curd-viscous richness that works in the context of its balanced acidity.
title: Belden Barns 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: This is a medium-bodied white offers plenty of personality, displaying tones of vanilla wafer and Meyer lemon. These flavors combine effortlessly on the palate to provide a well-balanced experience.
designation: Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled
title: Balletto 2015 Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tight aromas of lime, wet stone and bright lemon are quite fresh on the nose of this well-priced wine. There is tension to the palate, carrying flavors of nectarine, white melon and tangy citrus.
title: Ballard Lane 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a full-bodied, fleshy and oaky white, intense in flavor and grippy power. It delivers tones of anise and lavender amidst succulent layers of white nectarine and green apple.
title: Artesa 2016 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: This wine is packed full of ripe apple and pear flavors that are accented by vanilla and butter. This is a full-bodied, barrel-fermented wine that's big in profile but smooth in feel.
title: Lava Cap 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (El Dorado)

description: Weighty and oaky on the front of the palate, this settles into a balanced embrace of exotic guava, mango and anise, brightened by a refreshing undercurrent of acidity.
title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a barrel-fermented white that fully embraces its richness in the form of a baked pear, caramel and crème brûlée. It's full bodied and ample in fruit, with an underlying crispness that brightens the finish.
title: Michael Mondavi Family Estate 2016 Emblem Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This lush and rounded wine is brimming in tones of golden delicious apple, mango and pear. The palate is viscous in texture and shows robust flavors of crème brûlée and baking spice that finish with a touch of crisp acidity.
title: Merry Edwards 2015 Olivet Lane Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Full of melon and crème brûlée richness, this is a delightfully lush white from grapes grown across the appellation. It shows layered concentration and strong, lingering flavors of pineapple and caramel.
title: MacRostie 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Golden in color this white offers big flavor and high-toned freshness, a broadly expansive and contrasting palate of lemon, and lime and green apple dipped in nutmeg and clove.
title: Daniel 2015 Sangiacomo Vella Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: This twist-top bottling is an excellent choice for affordable, crisp style of Chardonnay that would go well with shellfish. Aromas of pear flesh and chalk lead into a grippy palate that's full of wet stone minerality and citrus flavors.
title: Bishop's Peak 2017 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)

description: From the producer's Martaella Estate Vineyard, planted to heirloom clones, this is a lovely white, buttery in texture with a crisp backbone that balances the lushness on the palate with freshness. Green apple, blood orange and toasted oak mingle effortlessly and with a touch of spice.
title: Benovia 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is a dry, expansive and fleshy expression of lemon, lime and Gravenstein apple. The oak is supportive and lightly toasted, giving it a warm, inviting undertone.
title: Balletto 2016 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This appellation blend is a very down-the-middle style of classic California Chardonnay, with ample amounts of oak, butter, baked lemon and ripe apple on the nose. The palate pairs golden apples with buttercream and a light brush of vanilla, with acid that powers deep into the finish.
title: Talley 2016 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: One of the original bottlings from the region, this is always a reliable and classic coastal Chardonnay. Tangy aromas of grapefruit, orange and chalk lead into a tense palate where racy acidity frames apple rind and lime flavors.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Richness of flavor and an especially creamy, melting texture help this wine stand out in a crowd. The wine is 80% barrel fermented and aged on the lees. It has concentrated and ripe pear, peach and apple flavors and a silky mouthfeel.
title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2017 Arlene Chardonnay (Suisun Valley)

description: Fleshy in defined flavors of peach and pear, this is a bright white wine, defined by perfumed aromas of jasmine and white flower. Fresh acidity supports a moderate structure of balanced ripeness.
title: Ancien 2016 Musque Chardonnay (Coombsville)

description: This widely available wine is a solid catch and stands out with its beautiful packaging. It offers a smoky nose that's complemented by lemon peel and sandalwood. Oak shows prominently on the palate, where smoked peach, melon and more lemon ride a creamy texture.
title: True Myth 2016 Paragon Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This barrel-fermented wine from an Anderson Valley institution has very nice balance, lots of juicy, fresh and ripe apple and peach flavors and a lightly tangy texture due to good acidity. It's medium bodied, easy to sip and will please a lot of different palates.
title: Navarro 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Creamy and lush in texture, this boldly ripe white flirts with tropical flavors of pineapple, guava and mango. Its full-bodied complexity is additionally marked by exotic elements of anise and fig.
title: Knights Bridge 2016 West Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: Named for estate owner Charlie's mother, this is an intense and powerful white, fiercely strong in acidity and lingering layers of Gravenstein apple and a squeeze of lemon. The lasting finish of integrated oak takes on a characteristic of hazelnut that's hugely pleasing.
title: Charles Heintz 2015 Rachael Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Broad, clean aromas of melon, mango and guava are cut by a chalky minerality on the nose of this bottling. Bright, tropical flavors on the palate glide along a river of fresh acidity.
title: Olelo 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Get ready for a different take on Chardonnay in this earthy, layered wine. It has an unusually deep golden color, mature aromas like baked apples and a nutty, honeyed flavor akin to that of a late-harvest dessert wine. The flavors develop nicely with each sip and reveal subtleties of fruit and mineral that linger on the finish.
title: Longevity 2017 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: This wine starts with plush aromas of yellow melon, plumeria, wild lime sorbet and a hint of cream. There is ample zip to the palate, where acidity and a strong floral character keep the honeydew and white peach flavors in check.
title: J. Lohr 2017 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Crisp and floral, this wine has mid-tier structure and is ultimately clean, focused and unfussy in style. Restrained ripeness allows room for lemon zest, grapefruit and persistent acidity to shine.
title: Côte West 2016 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A thick, rich and oak-laden white on entry, this coastal-influenced white is crunchy in green apple, melon and mango. Ultimately balanced and medium bodied in ripeness and body weight, it finishes in a pleasing note of Meyer lemon.
title: Charles Heintz 2015 Searby Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Quite rich on the nose, this bottling from a historic property deep in the appellation shows loads of honeysuckle and gardenia on the nose as well as lemon bar, nectarine, candied apple and a flash of nuts. It lands with ripe power on the palate, carrying hints of mango and pome fruits.
title: Riverbench 2016 Bedrock Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Toasted oak, sandalwood, pine, lemon peels and dried apple show on the nose of this bottling from the appellation's northernmost stretches. The palate starts with the freshness of cut lemon before dwelling back on the intense and savory qualities of aged wood and sea salt.
title: Neely 2016 Holly's Cuvee Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Fleshy and full bodied, this wine shows a pronounced toasted-oak character, with swirls of pineapple and caramel contributing additional richness. Still, it retains enough acidity to offer a juicy core and lasting freshness amidst the fruit.
title: Groth 2016 Hillview Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The 2016 vintage is strong for this well-established winery's Chardonnays, and this twist-top appellation blend is a more affordable way to indulge. Broad, fleshy aromas of ripe Asian pear, sea salt and nectarine tart lead into a rich palate that's rip with lemon and yellow pear but defined by penetrating acidity and decent tension.
title: Bernardus 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: While steely in acidity, this wine offers a counterbalance of fleshy pineapple and mango flavors. It finds a balance between both sides of the equation and also shows great integration with the oak.
title: Au Contraire 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A blend of grapes from the pioneering family's properties in Livermore and Arroyo Seco, this starts with aromas of pear flesh, lime skin, bright tangerine, honeydew and a touch of chalk. There is a tropical streak to the palate, but it's energetic and balanced, showing flavors of guava, mango and ripe red apple, all honed in by a tight pink-grapefruit-pith structure.
title: Wente 2016 Coastal Selection Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Well balanced and medium bodied, this wine from a unique mountainside vineyard combines good elements of natural acidity for freshness with ripe apple and pear for flavor. A smooth, layered mouthfeel wraps it all up nicely.
title: Townley 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This is a tense, tart and crisply mineral-laden white wine, thick on entry in peach and melon flavor. The midpalate finds peace and balance, allowing a slight bit of reduction to linger and the finish to focus in acidity.
title: Jordan 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A tiny-production wine, this is thick, dense and concentrated upon entry, finding its way to freshness and balance via a midpalate of stone fruit, wet stone and salted oak.
title: Ancien 2015 Haynes Old Block Chardonnay (Coombsville)

description: Voluptuously fleshy and rounded in oak, this earthy white shines in spicy ginger and lemongrass before unfurling lush layers of green apple, pear and mango that stick to the palate through a lengthy finish.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A rich, robust and lushly textured wine, this features toasted oak and spice tones, with strong flavors of butterscotch and tropical mango.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Light buttery notes complement fruit and salted oak in this dry, tannic and full-bodied white. The texture is grainy and lengthy, with flavors of ginger and lemongrass that work well against the riper, bolder aspects.
title: Lawer 2016 Betsy's Vineyard Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: A mostly stainless-steel fermented effort, this wine succeeds in floral, earthy, robust and richly layered richness, teasing caramel and vanilla crème brûlée out of the glass. With full-bodied oomph, it tingles in an underlying thread of stony mineral.
title: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Reduced on the nose, this full-bodied wine is spicy, earthy, dark and dense, with strong flavors of Gravenstein apple and nutmeg. The aromas are floral, a hearty mix of honeysuckle and apple blossom.
title: Flanagan 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Salty stone and lemon zest offer a blend of deep prolonged flavor in this well-made white that is bittersweet in oak and managed tannin. There's an intensity to the finish of baked apple, pear and fig.
title: Stewart Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Salty green apple and taffy give this robustly rounded, textured and layered wine a focus and bright streak that's met by earthy mineral qualities of wet stone and sea spray.
title: Riley's Rows 2016 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Intensely ripe and full bodied on entry, this wine settles into a more balanced sensibility of caramel apple, salty oak and robust flavors of candied apple and pear.
title: Migration 2016 Running Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Pungent in earthy compost and a touch of matchstick, this wine offers strong, sturdy flavors and body, with a silkiness on the midpalate. Intense flavors of baked apple and pineapple are softened and balanced by a lasting embrace of acidity.
title: Lynmar 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a great entry-level wine, starting with aromas of lemongrass, Asian pear, pomelo pith, chalk and a slight hint of butter. There is strong tactile energy on the sip, which grabs hold of the palate with a lime pith edge then settles into creamier lemon-balm flavors.
title: Zotovich 2016 Zoto Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Clean aromas of citrus-laced crème brûlée and creamy white peach make for an inviting entry to the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high atop the appellation. Those elements tighten on the palate to focus more on lime zest before the richer vanilla and peach-custard flavors lead into a caramelized finish.
title: Velvet Bee 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There is a strong amount of smoke and oak on the nose of this bottling, but there's also elegant touches of creamy Asian pear and lemon rind. That citrus and smoke combination shows on the sip as well, along with sweet touches of apple flesh and a compelling sandalwood flavor.
title: Byron 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: From the same vineyard that makes up the bulk of the producer's Unfiltered Chardonnay, this shows a rounded, textured and oaky profile of peach, Granny Smith apple and vanilla bean. Flavorful and fruity, it has salty acidity in the background supporting the fruit.
title: Newton 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Good balance and lively acidity make this dry, medium-bodied wine especially attractive. Fresh yet concentrated pear, almond and cream flavors start slowly, then build on the palate.
title: B Side 2016 Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: This widely available wine offers warm aromas of white peach, hazelnut and almond that are cut by a pink-lemonade scent. Lemon-lime acidity fires up the palate immediately, but then settles into stone fruit and oak flavors.
title: Estancia 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The vineyard shines in this white, a focused, fresh and fleshy expression of stone, mineral, lemon zest and peel. Light bodied and fresh in the glass, it has a bite of power and tannin on the finish.
title: Domenica Amato 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe orange pith and lemon zest show on the very fresh, chalky nose of this bottling. Lemon rinds dominate the palate, but warm toast also comes through in the midpalate, giving broad depth to the sip.
title: Blair 2015 Delfina's Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: With a noble sense of reduction on the nose, this wine is taut and tart in acidity, focused in Meyer lemon and balanced oak. A grainy texture adds complexity to the light-bodied ripeness.
title: Sonoma Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This blend of 75% Bien Nacido Vineyard and 25% Sierra Madre offers sea salt, lemon rind, honeysuckle extract and a hint of blanched almonds on the nose. There is fresh and tightly wound citrus on the tip of the palate, and then it warms up toward almond and orange-cookie flavors.
title: Rusack 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Soft nectarine flesh is cut by key lime and a touch of brioche on the nose of this bottling. It's relatively light and tightly focused on the palate, where poached pear, red apple, cherimoya and the slightest hint of butterscotch flavors arise.
title: Gainey 2016 Limited Selection Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Lush and expansive, with moderate oak and acidity, this is a big, bolder style of white, mineral in stone and rock, with exotic fruit flavors of apple and pineapple. A trace of green olive lingers on the succulent finish.
designation: Three Sisters Unfiltered Don Miguel Vineyard
title: Kelleher 2015 Three Sisters Unfiltered Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: This is a compelling wine at a good price point, showing warm aromas of hazelnut and baked bread along with fresh sprays of orange zest and honeysuckle. Toast and blanched almond flavors on the palate are lifted by citrus zest and gardenia.
title: Pull 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Hazelnut, seared lemon rinds and sandalwood reflect the various oak types used in the making of this wine. The palate also reflects that wood, with lightly toasted oak flavors holding up the seared lemon and herb-roasted chicken elements.
title: Lumen 2015 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Honey, brioche and layers of pineapple and mango give this youthful estate wine a richness that's hard to resist. It's supported by integrated oak that's toasty and sprinkled in a nutmeg tone. Steely acidity provides a backbone of freshness.
title: Jarvis 2016 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Dark gold in color, this wine offers uplifting acidity and matchstick-strong elements that balance well against powerful layers of green apple, melon and pear. The ripeness is in check.
title: Covenant 2015 Lavan Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Fleshy, this wine offers a roundness of oak and lushness on the midpalate, presenting as brioche and peach Melba. Structured with plenty of acidity as its backbone, it finishes in a concentrated swirl of crème brûlée.
title: Anaba 2015 J McK Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: An attractive, spicy oak aroma leads to butter and vanilla flavors and a broad creamy texture. The wine feels full bodied, tastes toasty and rich without overdoing it, and has a lingering finish.
title: Brutocao 2016 Bliss Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: This wine has a pretty nose of apple blossom and jasmine. Present, persistent oak gives it a roundness and richness that complements mango, wet stone and lemon-drop flavors and tight focused acidity.
title: Hartford Court 2015 Sevens Bench Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Light in the glass, this wine starts with a touch of sandalwood on the nose alongside preserved lemon, toast and oak. The palate offers a firm textural grip, then leads into tangy lemon rind, sour apple and a bit more toasted oak flavors.
title: Gainey 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: New oak shapes the texture and heavily dominates the flavors of this firm and spicy wine. It shows vanilla and nutmeg in the aroma, and crisp apple flavors seasoned with ginger and cinnamon. Good acidity and a touch of tannin make it snappy on the palate. Aged in new Hungarian barrels, it needs some time to mellow. Best after 2020.
title: Poseidon 2015 Boon Fly's Hill Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Pungent in nutty oak, this wine is hearty and reduced, with a steeliness on the palate. Mango, pineapple and brioche figure into the richness, while the midpalate tacks on a lemony brightness with moderate complexity.
title: Tognetti 2015 Aloise Francisco Vineyards Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Pretty in jasmine on the nose, this wine offers juicy stone fruit within a rounded, likable framework of balanced richness and lingering acidity.
title: Merryvale 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Aged and fermented in stainless steel and in the barrel, this white is richly concentrated in baked flavors of quince and pear. Up-front in its intensity, it opens to reveal floral aromas and bright acidity midpalate and through a lengthy, lightly spiced finish.
title: Medlock Ames 2016 Lower Slope Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: High-toned in fleshy peach and apricot with a nod of Good & Plenty licorice, this big-boned, structured and lushly crafted wine stands out with its complement of rich concentrated fruitiness and toasty oak.
title: Lucie 2016 Dutton Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A toasty, oaky, spicy aroma precedes equally oaky flavors that are nevertheless backed by ripe, juicy pear and ginger notes. These tones expand on the palate and linger on the finish. It's full bodied and broad in texture.
title: Matchbook 2016 The Arsonist Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Spicy in honeyed oak, this full-bodied wine is bright in acidity and strong flavors of lime and lemon verbena. Balanced and integrated despite its complete embrace of ripeness, it allows for a brightness of acidity beneath grainy texture and grip.
title: V. Sattui 2016 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: From the estate's Don Miguel Vineyard in cool-climate Green Valley, this wine is floral on the nose, with a pronounced jasmine note. The palate is weighty in oak and tropical fruit tones, with fleshy richness of baked peach and apple pie.
title: Marimar Estate 2016 La Masía Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a blend of the best barrel lots and is not made every year. For this vintage, it opens in floral gardenia and green olive, imparting spicy acidity and tart tastes of green apple, pear and peach. Bright on entry, it has an underling richness and depth of concentration that's fleshy and lush.
title: Frostwatch 2015 Ophira Reserve Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

description: This bottling from a newer property at the entrance to Carmel Valley is very fresh on the nose with aromas of sweet honeysuckle, candied banana and a very prominent pineapple note. That pineapple persists powerfully on the palate, where it meets with citrusy acidity and a toasty oak touch.
title: Folktale 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Here's a rich, complex Chardonnay, made in the full-blown Burgundian way. The fruit itself gives layers of tropical guava, pineapple and nectarine flavors, while finely toasted oak adds caramel, buttered toast and spice flavors. With a creamy texture, it's a delicious wine all the way.
title: Hagafen 2005 Kosher Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Here's a young wine that will benefit from decanting. Freshly opened, it's a composite of new oak, citrus and tropical fruit and brisk acidity. Let it breathe and it all mingles together, creating a bright, richly complex Chardonnay. Will hold and improve over the next five years.
title: Saintsbury 2004 Brown Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Over the years, this has been a remarkably consistent wine, and the '05 is right up there in quality. Elegant and dry, it shows Carneros Chardonnay at its best, with forward tropical fruit, pear and peach flavors, and a gorgeously acidic, creamy structure.
title: MacRostie 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is the winery's stainless steel-fermented Chardonnay. It's a big, ripe, full-throttled wine, and without undergoing malolactic fermentation, it's also a bit raw in acidity. The flavors are enormous, suggesting baked apples, pineapple marmalade, sweet date tapenade, candied ginger and Asian spices. Could be a sleeper. Try aging it for five to ten years.
title: Ambullneo 2005 Big Paw Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A beautiful Chardonnay with powerful tropical fruit, lime, nectarine, apricot and new oak flavors. Firmer acidity than you usually get from Carneros. This is a sleek, elegant wine, with a bracing streak of steely minerality. Kudos to owner Jan Shrem for putting it into a screwcap.
title: Clos Pegase 2005 Mitsuko's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The vineyard has been a reliable source of Chardonnays that display a good Carneros character. Acidity is never a problem, and the wines often have a Chablis-like minerality. Ripeness varies by vintage; this wine is from a cooler season, and shows lime zest and tart green apple flavors that new oak has made creamy and rich.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2005 Truchard Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Tastes superoaky, with a heavy layer of wood spice and butterscotchy char, but the underlying fruit is powerful enough to support it. The pineapple tart, peach custard and cinnamon flavors are crisp and juicy with acidity.
title: Cobblestone 2005 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Apples, acidity and oak are what this is all about. Green apples, that is, baked into pie, and that includes the buttery, cinnamony, sugary pie crust. The acidity is amazing, but that may partly be due to the cool vintage. Classy, sleek Chard, with quite a bit of elegance.
title: Rochioli 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a good, rich white Burgundy-inspired Chard, creamy in barrel-fermented vanilla custard and opulant lemon drop mousse, peach pie and smoky pie crust flavors. Balanced and dry, it's enriched with crisp, savory acidity.
title: Alma Rosa 2005 El Jabali Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A blend of the Foley and Sweeney vineyards, both of them top estates, this Chard has rich lemon drop and mineral flavors, with a subtle coat of toasty oak. It's crisp and clean and very fine.
title: Longoria 2005 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This bottling from Rutz has been one of the better Chards you can buy at this price point. It's classic Russian River, dry and crisp in acids, with plush, ripe green apple, pineapple and juicy lemon and lime flavors. Oak, lees and the rest of the Burgundian bells and whistles add all sorts of creamy, textural, spicy complexities.
title: Rutz 2004 Maison Grand Cru Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Crispness and minerals are the key to understanding this elegant wine. It has peaches, apples, mangoes and plenty of charry oak, but so do many California Chards. What makes it special is the bright, steely hardness, a flinty character that cries out for food, such as Ahi tuna tartare on a buttery, garlicky crostini.
title: Girard 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lincourt is the second label of Foley, a major force in Santa Rita Hills, and this county-wide bottling shows a lot of class and finesse. It's a Chablis-type Chard, totally dry, high in acidity, with a mineral, metallic quality to the peach flavors. The finish is so rich and complex. What a great food wine.
title: Lincourt 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Really rich; a big, oaky Chardonnay that works because it's so balanced. Reams of ripe tropical fruits, gingerbread, vanilla custard, buttered toast, the works, and it's all framed in fine, citrusy acids.
title: Clos La Chance 2004 Liebler Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Here's a big, bright Chard notable for the purity of its acid-driven fruit. Kiwis, limes, pineapples, sweet lemongrass and peach are enriched by lees aging in new oak, leading to an impressively rich, dry finish.
title: Perbacco Cellars 2005 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: There's a rich, deep earthiness flowing underneath the fruit that's reminiscent of cured tobacco, a sweetly resinous note that complexes the pineapples and guavas. Add oaky creaminess and char, and you've got a really good Chardonnay.
title: Clos La Chance 2004 Biagini Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Shows the lean, structural approach Farrell famously takes toward his wines. It's almost an austere Chard. You get dryness, acidity, alcohol, oak, lees, and citrusy, flowery fruit. This is not one of your big, fat Chards, but it is a complex wine that will benefit from four or five years of cellaring.
title: Gary Farrell 2004 Westside Farms Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Achieves the alchemy of well-toasted oak and perfectly ripe fruit to produce this luscious, creamy Chardonnay. Mangoes, papayas, pineapple custard, caramel, vanilla, it's all there, along with crisp, balancing acidity.
title: Simi 2004 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of fancy footwork in this single-vineyard Chard. Really pleases with its deft arrangement of fine, toasty oak, ripe tropical fruit, creamy lees and refreshing acids. Displays poise and finesse, from a producer with long experience working with this vineyard.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2004 Robert Young Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Some people will think this is too oaky, but I like that buttered toast and caramelized, butterscotchy vanilla, especially when it's married to a wine with this powerful fruit and acidity. Pineapple, mango, nectarine and cinnamon spice flavors lead to a long, rich finish on this satisfying, creamy wine.
title: J. Lohr 2004 Arroyo Vista Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Take Keller's unoaked Chard, add some well-toasted new French oak, and you get this rich version. The oak stars, putting out buttered toast, crème brûlée and vanilla spice flavors. Down under all that is a wealth of tropical fruit, peach and green apple flavors.
title: Keller Estate 2004 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: The winery must have held this back this long to let the acidity soften, but it's still a crisp Chardonnay. A big one, too, packed with tropical fruit, roasted coconut, creamy lees, steely mineral and new oak flavors. Give it until 2007 to resolve itself.
title: Talbott 2003 Sleepy Hollow Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: At four-plus years, the wine is hanging in there, maintaining fruit and freshness and picking up some aged, dried pineapple and peach character. It's an interesting wine, picking up textural complexities, but needs to be drunk soon.
title: Mosaic 2002 Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Many Napa Chards taste earthy, and so does this one. The earthiness is about green herbs, tobacco and soy-flavored tofu, but there's also plenty of pineapple fruit. On top of that, considerable new oak gives a blast of vanilla and spice. This interesting, complex Chard should challenge chefs to rise to the occasion.
title: Amici 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very clean and dry, high in citrusy acidity, and with a steely minerality. This streamlined Chard aims for structure, not opulence. The flavors are of white peaches and smoky oak. Defines the Farrell style of detailed elegance.
title: Gary Farrell 2004 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Super-ripe in tropical papaya, pineapple and white peach flavors, with a charry, caramel sweetness that seems to come from oak. Sweet clove and anise on the finish.
title: Roche 2004 Reserve American Oak Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Younger and a bit more raw than the '03, and the oak is sticking out more boldly, but this should be a fine bottle in much the same fashion as its predecessor in a year or so. There's a purity throughout that's outstanding.
title: Carpe Diem 2004 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Morgan has hit its stride with this unoaked Chardonnay. Nothing comes between the intense citrus, pineapple, white peach, apple and spice flavors and your palate. Cleansing acidity boosts it all and makes the wine star-bright. Morgan leads the pack of California unoaked Chards.
title: Morgan 2005 Metallico Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: There's massive flavor in this wine, made from young Dijon clone vines. It's a real bomb blast of juicy apricot, pineapple custard, white peach nectar, tapioca and honeysuckle, with a tangy mineral flourish. Almost too rich for its own good, but retains balance, with good acidity.
title: Foley 2004 Clone 76 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Very crisp in zesty acidity, bone dry, and with exotic flavors. This stony, minerally Chardonnay impresses for its firm structure. Flavorwise, it's explosive in lemons, limes, crunchy pears, Asian spices and buttery vanilla, even though it's unoaked. Showcases its terroir in a fine way.
title: Huber 2005 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: From this large vineyard in the heart of the appellation comes this tight, young Chard. It's high in acidity, creating a tart mouthfeel containing mineral, Meyer lemon, green apple, apricot, kiwi and oak flavors. Don't drink it too cold, because it grows more complex as it warms in the glass.
title: Foley 2004 Rancho Santa Rosa Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Tighter and more citrusy than the regular Chardonnay, with the oak coming across as more restrained, although the proportion of new wood is undoubtedly higher. It's a subtly nutty, textural wine, with apple and lemon notes that linger on the finish.
title: Buena Vista 2004 Ramal Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Tastes like there's lots of toasty, charry, smoky oak on this big, ripe wine, but the papaya, nectarine and hazelnut croissant flavors are sizeable and can shoulder the wood. The finish is long, spicy and impressively rich.
title: Mi Sueño 2004 Ulises Valdez Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Notable for high, stimulating acidity and purity of flavor, this lovely Chard brims with lime, mineral, white peach and apricot flavors, wrapped into a lush, creamy texture. It's an elegant, classy wine that improves as it breathes in the glass.
title: Carpe Diem 2003 Firepeak Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Try this if you're curious what Chardonnay does when it's just starting to develop bottle complexities. The primary fruit is fading, leaving behind dried apricot, quince and peach flavors with overtones of herbs and clay. The wine is super-dry and remains high in acidity. Should hang in there through this decade.
title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2001 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Forward in tropical pineapple and lime pie flavors, and well-oaked, this Chard has a lush, creamy texture. What gives pause is the very high acidity leading to a tart finish. Strong enough to cut through lobster, but has the firmness of structure to develop over the next five years.
title: Testarossa 2004 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This winery's Chardonnays are long-lived, but that means they're tight and hard in youth. Even though this one's more than three years old, it's still high in acids and the fruit is locked down under a straitjacket of steel and minerals. Best left alone until 2007, and should hold for 10 years afterward.
title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: What's so interesting about this Chardonnay is the dryness and the earthy minerality. There are flavors of dried herbs and dried fruits, such as apricots, lemons and pink grapefruits. Usually these Dijon clones produce enormously fruity wines, but this fine wine has a sleek, high-acid Chablisian elegance.
title: Pine Ridge 2004 Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Chardonnay from Napa mountains? Yes. The wine is tightly packed and nervy, as far from a fat, opulent Chard as you can imagine. Thoroughly dry, with a minerality behind the citrus flavors, which suggests aging in a cool cellar for a good decade.
title: Keenan 2004 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

description: The source of dependably rich Chards, Rosella's has given Bernardus the opportunity to craft a wonderfully complex wine. It's ripe in flavors ranging from lime tart and kiwi to papaya, nectarine and Anjou pear. Delicious, although it would benefit from higher acidity.
title: Bernardus 2002 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This Paso Robles-based winery has reached into cool-climate Edna Valley for their Chardonnay, with good results. The wine has good acidity and is dry and minerally, with citrus fruit flavors. Try with cracked crab and a well-buttered sourdough baguette.
title: Martin & Weyrich 2003 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Another interesting Chard from this Santa Lucia Highlands estate; why the Wagners don't put that appellation on the label is a mystery. The wine seems even higher in acidity than usual, with greater ageworthiness, and experience shows this is one for the cellar. The tropical fruit flavors are well oaked, and finish absolutely dry. Best after 2008.
title: Mer Soleil 2003 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Monterey Chards often exhibit this aroma, which makes you think you could pick them out in a blind tasting. The wine smells fresh and juicy, with Key lime pie and tropical fruit notes. In the mouth, it's rich, fruit-forward and oaky. This Chard is designed to dazzle.
title: Wines of Carmel 2003 Vintner's Selection Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This sure is an oaky Chard, but it's big enough to handle it. The fruit is extraordinarily ripe and forward, bursting with mango, pear and sautéed banana flavors. What the wine lacks in subtlety it makes up for in sheer, unadulterated power.
title: Silverado 2004 Vineburg Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Built along the same lines as Mondavi's regular Chard, this is an earthy wine whose fruit is restrained. It's sleek and elegant, very Chablisian in style, with a minerality through the finish. Should hold and improve.
title: Robert Mondavi 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: That crisp Monterey acidity accompanies this Chard all the way, boosting and brightening the pineapple custard, coconut cream pie and vanilla spice flavors. It's a rich, decadent wine that finishes with a honeyed sweetness.
title: J. Lohr 2003 Arroyo Vista Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: From an estate in the appellation's tenderloin, an intensely minerally, high-acid wine with bright citrus flavors and lots of sweet, flashy oak that adds a vanilla-cream richness. This is unusually food-friendly and versatile for a Chardonnay.
title: Huber 2004 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Cool climate all the way, from the brisk, metallic, acidic mouthfeel to the flavors of citrus zest, with a hint of peach. The winemaker has added notes of lees and delicate oak that enrich the wine and bring it to completion.
title: Talbott 2002 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Very bright and zingy, with that brilliant shine of citrusy acidity you find in a good Carneros Chard. The apple, peach and spice flavors finish in a rich, creamy swirl of fruit and oak.
title: Robert Stemmler 2002 Three Clone Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This Chard is oakier and leesier than Babcock's Rita's Earth Cuvée. Consequently, it's a fuller-bodied, heavier wine. Softer and fatter, too. It has opulently ripe New World flavors of pineapple custard and vanilla cream pie.
title: Babcock 2003 Grand Cuvee Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: From down Santa Maria way comes this high-acid wine, with yummy flavors of pineapple custard, key lime pie and vanilla spice, all of it pepped up with lots of rich, toasty oak.
title: Vine Cliff 2003 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: I have tasted a number of bottle-aged Hanzell Chardonnays, and when properly cellared from a good vintage, they are totally amazing. This is likely to be such a wine, but right now, it's tight, tart and earthy, with hints of peach. It's not a mind blower, but is a Chard for those serious about their cellars. Best after 2010.
title: Hanzell 2002 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Only Edna Valley could produce this remarkably bold, bright acidity and rich key lime pie and sauteed banana flavors. Oak is the perfect partner, adding smoky vanillins and buttercream.
title: Bianchi 2004 Jack Ranch Signature Selection Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This winery continues to turn out some of the most consistently good wines in California. Here's a Chard that lets the terroir shine, rather than overwhelming with bells and whistles. It's clean in acids and dry, with complex citrus, peach, spiced apple and meringue flavors.
title: Clos Pegase 2003 Mitsuko's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Compared to those fat, rich Chards that are hard to pair with food, this one's Chablisian. It's tart in acids and tangy in minerals and stones, with a richly controlled taste that's part apple-citrus fruit and part oak.
title: Domaine Chandon 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Everything's controlled in this balanced, harmonious Chard. The tropical fruit is ripe, oak is judiciously applied, creamy lees are just right. It's a very elegant, pure wine that gets better and better with every sip.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This single-vineyard wine has been produced for a long time. Its longevity is explained by the balance and harmony it usually shows. Soft and dry, the wine has pear, peach and buttercream flavors that finish with elegance and finesse.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2002 Robert Young Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This ultraexpensive Chardonnay comes down along mineral, steel and wet stone flavors. It's well-oaked,  although you'll find tropical fruit, subtly, on the finish. It's extremely elegant, with a long draw of acidity and a classic structure.
title: Chalk Hill 2002 Estate Vineyard Selection Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: This gentle, balanced and very fine wine displays consummate artistry in winemaking. It has enough fruit, oak and creaminess to satisfy that Chard craving, without any one element sticking out, and manages to be big while retaining finesse and elegance.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2003 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Richer than the '02, this single-vineyard Chard is crisp and bright in acidic structure, with oak and lees to add complexity. The underlying flavors suggest citrus fruits, peaches, pears, apricots and mangoes.
title: Peters Family 2003 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Like most Chards these days, this wine is boldly flavored, oaky and rich. But it goes beyond the tropical fruits, vanilla and buttercream to achieve real finesse and elegance. The crisp acidity helps make it balanced.
title: Simi 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: If you don't put oak on a Chardonnay, you better have some powerful fruit. It's hard to imagine any Chard being fruitier than this. Absolutely delicious in apples, limes, peaches and pineapples, with wonderfully bright acidity.
title: Tolosa 2004 Edna Ranch No Oak Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: I have enjoyed this unoaked Chard since Morgan started producing it. Made largely from the same fruit as the winery's  more expensive bottlings, the wine exhibits bright, crisp Santa Lucia acidity, and lime, Meyer lemon and papaya flavors. It's compellingly drinkable.
title: Morgan 2004 Metallico Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: The heat of Paso hasn't given this Chard much acidity, but in its place you'll find beautifully ripened fruit. It tastes like peaches floating in natural cream, drizzled with honey and vanilla and just a dash of creme de cassis. It's really quite an impressive wine.
title: Eberle 2004 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: This crowd pleaser is rich in tropical fruit, buttered toast, caramelized oak and vanilla flavors. It has a spicy, creamy texture, and is thoroughly balanced. It's a flamboyant Chard that doesn't tire the palate.
title: Charles Krug 2003 Family Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: One of the best Chards in this price category, this Monterey example is rich in tropical fruit, peach and spice flavors, and crisp in acidity. It has smoky oak, buttercream, a bit of lees-in other words, the works.
title: J. Lohr 2003 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Displays all the flair of Monterey's terroir, with tropical fruit flavors and crisp, bright acidity that makes even this rich wine finish clean. Oak adds just the right touch of charry vanilla.
title: Morgan 2003 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Although this Chard was put through malolactic, it's quite acidic, stimulating the tastebuds with citrusy brightness. There are richer flavors of pears and smoky, buttered toast. This is the kind of Chard that gets more interesting in the glass as it warms up.
title: MacRostie 2003 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is an interesting, terroir-driven wine. It's at that fascinating knife's edge where it's losing its peach and apple fruit and picking up a rich, honeyed minerality. Bone dry, it's crisp in acids and complex, a "food wine" to use that overused term.
title: Scherrer 2001 Scherrer Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: A good, honest and earthy Chardonnay that smacks of terroir. Shows apple, pear and herb flavors, with soft acids and a long, oaky-sweet finish. Finishes balanced and elegant.
title: DeLorimier 2002 Clonal Select Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Dry and acidy-tart, this is a wine of great structure and balance. The flavors veer toward lime custard, mangoes, apricots, vanilla and slate, with a gentle overlay of toasty oak. It's quite a sophisticated Chardonnay, and a great value.
title: Murphy-Goode 2002 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Rich and oaky, this is one of those Chards that's so good right out the gate, it washes down just about anything. Ripe in tropical fruits, peaches and apples, with a buttery, creamy texture, it's got clean, juicy acids.
title: Cinnabar 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Bright, perky fruit stars in this lovely wine. It's ripe in pineapple and tangerine, with a rich, custard and meringue finish, but it's dry and complex. Easy to like.
title: Geyser Peak 2003 Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: My favorite of N&N's three new single-vineyard Chards. Shows broad appeal with its array of peach, apple and tropical fruit flavors, heightened with touches of oak and lees. Young and crisp in acids, it's full-bodied enough to accompany roast duck.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2003 Searby Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Quite an interesting wine, chewy and dense in apple, melon and peach fruits and oak, with a chalky, minerally taste that adds texture. Turns tart with acids on the finish.
title: Bannister 2002 Porter-Bass Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a nicely balanced Chard that combines rich fruit with impeccable style and finesse. It's ripely forward in pineapple, mango, butterscotch, buttered toast and vanilla, and has vivacious acidity and a clean, harmonious finish.
title: Acacia 2003 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: High acidity combines with extreme spiciness to make this wine exceedingly prickly on the palate. Thankfully it's filled with yummy flavors of pineapple custard, butterscotch, caramel and toast, and has a rich, creamy texture. Fabulous with lobster.
title: Londer 2003 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: If you like plenty of delicious flavor in your Chards, try this beauty. It's big and fat with butterscotch and vanilla drizzled over baked pineapple pie, in a rich, creamy texture. The spicy finish makes you want another pour.
title: Artesa 2002 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Bigger and richer than the Starmont bottling, with correspondingly heavier oak. Lots of toast and grilled pineapple and peach notes on the nose, followed by a mouthfilling wine laced with smoky accents. Echoes of butter and dark toast on the finish.
title: Merryvale 2002 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: These high-acid grapes have made for a mouthwateringly crisp wine, with deliciously provocative flavors of high-toned citrus fruits, including oranges, and lots of vanilla and buttered toast. Clean, complex and satisfying.
title: Iron Horse 2002 Estate Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: At five-plus years of age, this Chard's fruit takes a backseat to stone, mineral and herb flavors, in addition to its original oak. It's bone dry, with crisp acids. Complex and interesting, it finishes with a dusty earthiness. Drink now.
title: Lookout Ridge 2000 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Packs as much flavor as you can fit in a glass. Ultraripe pineapples and peaches, caramelized oak, toasty meringue, vanilla, the works. Plus, it's creamy, smooth and crisp.
title: Aquinas 2003 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: One of the more distinctive Chards I've had this year, notable especially for its very high acidity and mineral and lime complex. The lime tastes like a cool custard, flavored with vanilla, while the minerals bring to mind liquid steel. One hundred percent new French oak slathers it all with buttered toast.
title: Arcadian 2001 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Long in candied lime, papaya and buttered toast flavors, this lovely sipper is also crisp in acids. All the fruit drinks clean and minerally pure, like mountain water.
title: J. Lohr 2002 Arroyo Vista Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Fabulous intensity of flavor, all lemon custard, vanilla and oak. It is rich and mouthfilling, but with a good, hard minerality and tartness to the finish.
title: Flowers 2002 Andreen-Gale Cuvee Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Always rich and well structured, Schug's '03 is a dense, weighty Chard, supporting flavors of sweet lime, pear and pineapple elaborately seasoned with toast and vanilla. Finishes crisp and fruity.
title: Schug 2003 Heritage Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Richer upfront pineapple and savory white peach flavors than Keegan's Ritchie bottling, and with similar oak, it's a more forward, palate-flattering wine, and a softer one, as well. Made in the popular style, this is a real crowd-pleaser.
title: Keegan 2002 Buena Tierra Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A lovely Chard, filled with crisp acids and steely, stony minerals. The fruit flavors suggest powerfully ripened tropical fruits, and there's a bracing overlay of oak. Notable for its balance and integrity.
title: Sanford 2002 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Ed Sbragia's inaugural Chardonnay has much in common with the Reserve he crafts at Beringer, but perhaps not as much finesse. Impressive for the huge tropical fruit and overlay of toasty oak, and pretty acidic. Should hold for a few years.
title: Sbragia 2002 Gamble Ranch Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Exciting for its control and balance. There's some big fruit here, just bursting with pears and pineapples, but it's kept tight with acids and firm oak. Finishes long and slightly bitter from lees.
title: Freemark Abbey 2003 Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: Delicious Chardonnay from the Napa side of the appellation. Filled with ripe tropical fruit, pear, honey, caramel and smoky vanilla, in a rich and creamy texture that finishes long.
title: St. Clement 2002 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Textbook RRV Chard, with its bright, clean acids and savory flavors of ripe apples, pears and minerals, and dusty spices. All of this is well oaked, but the vanilla and char fit in just fine. The creamy texture adds allure.
title: Simi 2002 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Quite distinctive and complex for the intense minerality and herbal, cured tobacco overtones to the underlying citrus, peach fruit and oak flavors. There's something steely and metallic about the acidy structure that really gets the taste buds going.
title: Tandem 2002 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Tasted alongside Tandem's Sangiacomo bottling, this wine shares many of the same characteristics, including crisp acidity, minerality, and a seamless integration of oak. However, it's richer and fatter, although far from fat. It's a wine of intense structure and finesse.
title: Tandem 2002 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a tight, lemony Chardonnay for those who lean more toward the old Chablis style. It's a very dry, structural wine whose acids and tannins star as much as the fruit. Great elegance and pizzazz.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2002 Arcadia Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: It's all about ripe apples and oak in this crisp, elegant wine. Like biting into a fresh Granny Smith, that burst of acidic flavor startles, but is quickly softened by sweet oak.
title: Robert Mondavi 2002 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Shares much in common with the winery's Morelli bottling, except it's a shade less rich. Spicy tropical fruit flavors, smoky oak, a creamy texture and bright acidity make it wonderful to drink now.
title: Sebastopol 2001 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A really good, interesting Chard that marches to a different beat. Clean and zingy in fresh, bright acids that bite into the palate, carrying pure flavors of lime zest, vanilla and toast, in a creamy texture. Has a vitality that's especially appealing.
title: Navarro 2002 Premiere Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: A lovely Chardonnay brimming with tropical fruits, roasted hazelnut, sweet buttercream and gingery spices, with a good framework of oak. For all the flavor, there's a streamlined sleekness to the acids that keeps the mouthfeel clean and refreshing.
title: Byron 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A very fine Chard with special features that come from the appellation. The fruit is a melange of key lime pie and white peach, drizzled with vanilla and cinnamon, with hints of smoky oak. These mountains always seem to develop a firm, steely acidity that makes the wines ultraclean.
title: Byington 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Farrell likes to pick early, and thus trades opulence for acidity, elegance and possible ageworthiness. Here you'll find a tight, lemony wine, very crisp. The wine is marked by oak and lees, which add flavor and textural nuances, but it remains flinty and austere.
title: Gary Farrell 2002 Rochioli-Allen Vineyards Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A fine wine, with enough oaky richness to please Chard lovers. The flavors suggest cool peach custard sprinkled with vanilla and a drizzle of butterscotch sauce, while the acids keep this gooey quality crisp and fresh.
title: Vine Cliff 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Everything's on steroids in this big, big Chard. For starters, the tropical fruit and spice flavors are enormously ripe and concentrated. So is the oak, which has been liberally applied so that the wine bursts with vanilla and buttered toast. Fortunately, there's good acidity to keep everything balanced.
title: Miner 2002 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: An interesting, complex Chard that straddles the line between steely austerity and fruity complexity and pulls it off well. Has citrus and apple flavors with nuances of more flamboyant peach and pear, and a great burst of fresh acidity. The oak is barely noticeable. Finishes dry and elegant.
title: MacRostie 2002 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is an elegant Chard with apple, pear and toasted coconut flavors spiced with liberal doses of smoky oak and lees. It has very crisp, citrusy acids that make it clean and lively. Will be a good companion to a wide range of foods.
title: Merryvale 2001 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a deliciously drinkable Chard, sweet with pineapple and mango flavors and well-oaked, and with the excellent acidity to make it clean and bright. Lasts for a long time on the finish, turning spicy and reprising the mango theme.
title: Acacia 2002 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Crafted along leanly tailored, elegant lines, this wine has high acidity and a citrusy, mineral character. It's a wine of great structural integrity, focused and pristine, although it's also oaky. The right foods will coax out the inherent sweetness and Oriental spice.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2002 Truchard Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Balanced and harmonious, and has extra clarity due to its lovely acidity. There's an array of fruity flavor ranging from ripe green apples to candied grapefruit and mango, while oak adds vanilla and toast. Finishes long and spicy.
title: Wolff 2002 Old Vines Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Here's a powerful Chard that never loses its sense of balance. It is rich in pear, pineapple and mango flavors accompanied by notes of smoky oak and creamy lees. Feels fat and plush in the mouth.
title: Arrowood 2002 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: I love the juicy acidity in this wine. It lifts and brightens the lime, pineapple and breadfruit flavors and makes them shine. An edge of oak adds a pretty polish of smoky vanilla and toast. The combination of freshness and ripe fruit is delicious.
title: Husch 2001 La Ribera Vineyards Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Almost overripe, almost too alcoholic, almost overextracted, and flirts with being too oaky, but not quite, all of which makes this a big, fat Chardonnay that tests the limits. Nothing subtle about the blast of flavors and huge mouthfeel. As rich as it is, try with lobster and drawn butter.
title: M. Cosentino 2002 CE2V Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Sleek and minerally, a taut young Chard with high acidity and a steely spine. But there's a wealth of peach, pear, pineapple and vanilla flavor that bursts through the acids and spreads deliciously across the tongue. Tasty, rewarding and balanced.
title: Taylor 2002 Chardonnay (Stags Leap District)

description: Very lush, full and long on the palate, a rich and quite complex wine that mingles ultraripe tropical fruit flavors with creamy lees, sweet butterscotch and intense vanilla. It's a little soft in acidity, though.
title: Steven Kent 2001 Merrillie Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Well-oaked, this likeable wine features perky, citrusy acids that frame an array of peach, pineapple, sweet lime and other tropical fruits flavors. The texture is really pretty, like buttercream. Finishes with a touch of lees.
title: Rusack 2002 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Fascinating wine, with a cool edge of minerally acidity that teases the palate with intense green apple and ripe peach flavors, and a lavish overlay of what tastes like new French oak. It all comes together in this fine, plush Chardonnay.
title: Londer 2002 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Huge and massive are just two of the words that describe this incredibly fruity wine. It's intensely concentrated in pineapple and papaya flavors, and has a heavy layer of toasty oak. Drinks lusciously smooth and creamy, with a long, spicy finish.
title: Testarossa 2002 Castello Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This venerable Napa winery turned to a cool Sonoma locale and has crafted a rich, balanced Chardonnay. It has lush flavors of sweet green apples, cinnamon, vanilla and toast, and zesty, citrusy acids. Smooth drinking, and an excellent food wine that's not too big.
title: Girard 2002 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Just what the doctor ordered in a rich Chard. It's lavish in ripe peach, tropical fruit and vanilla flavors, with the sweetness of a fresh-baked buttery biscuit. The creamy texture carries spice flavors through a long finish.
title: Rodney Strong 2002 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: First rate, a winemaker's wine made from grapes with a real smack of terroir. High, citrusy acidity marks the well-ripened mango, tangerine and smoky-vanilla and leesy flavors that are wrapped in a richly creamy texture. Bold and complex.
title: Iron Horse 2001 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: A flamboyant style that emphasizes well-ripened fruit flavors, including tangerine and pineapple, and quite a bit of smoky oak. Bold, rich and opulent, with a creamy, honeyed texture.
title: Acacia 2002 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is not a bad price for such a good wine, from such a pedigreed vineyard. It's classic cool South Coast, with a crisp spine of citrusy acids that brighten the tropical fruit flavors. This is a generous, fat wine that offers lots of pleasure.
title: Villa Mt. Eden 2002 Bien Nacido Vineyard Grand Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Deep, lush and opulent, this complex wine has plenty of interest for its complexity. The fruity flavors are very ripe and veer into pineapple and mango, with a generous dose of smoky oak. The creamy texture and crisp acidity provide balance.
title: White Oak 2002 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Extraordinarily ripe fruit has been joined to lavish oak to make a big, strong Chard. The flavors are opulent mango, papaya and pineapple, and the oak is forward in spice, vanilla and buttered toast. There's an undertow of lees, joined to crisp acidity. Yummy stuff.
title: Hahn 2002 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Oaky, ripe and complex, a real crowd-pleaser of a Chard. Bursts on the palate with pineapple, mango, toasted coconut, buttered toast, vanilla and spices, wrapped in a creamy texture.
title: Ortman Family 2001 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Big, bold and delicious, a full-throttle Chard that's drenched with new oak notes of vanilla, spice and smoky char. Below that, the pear and pineapple flavors float in a creamy texture that's enhanced with good acidity. Give it a year to knit together.
title: Flora Springs 2002 Select Cuvee Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This wonderful Chard showcases the quality of its appellation. The smoky oak is pretty, and complements the pineapple and guava fruit, which has a firm streak of mineral running through it. The creamy smooth texture is balanced by refreshing acidity.
title: Sanford 2001 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A very fine and stylish Chardonnay made crisp and tight with a spine of steely acidity. The flavors are also cool-climatish, ranging from ripe citrus fruits to apples and peaches. There's quite a bit of oak and lees but both are perfectly in balance.
title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2001 Arcadia Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: 89-91 Leesy and custardy, with melon and lime flavors accented by toast. Rich and weighty; finishes with caramel.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2002 Camelot Highlands Estate Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Fruity and oaky, this pretty wine has flavors of ripe pears and figs, and a rich, creamy texture. It's clean and vibrant in the mouth, with just a slight trace of almond-skin bitterness in the finish. It's softer than the Blocks 9 & 21 bottling.
title: Hendry 2001 Blocks 19 & 20 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a tight, young wine, bursting with well-charred oak aromas and flavors that add smoke, vanilla and buttered toast to the underlying tropical fruit and spice flavors. There's also quite a bit of acidity, making this crisp wine lively and clean.
title: MacRostie 2000 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: From the same appellation as Morgan's Rosella's bottling, but very different, a leaner, crisper wine, although equally fine. Marked by high acids and citrusy flavors, it's been enriched with oak and lots of lees. A bit tight now; may be an ager.
title: Morgan 2001 Double L Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: High acidity adds a metallic, mineral firmness to the peach and pear flavors, while oak and lees contribute softer, creamy notes. This sleek wine is vibrant and perky through the spicy finish.
title: Morgan 2001 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Very rich and compelling, a beautiful wine with layers of tropical fruit, pear, buttered toast, vanilla and spicy aromas and flavors that mingle on the palate. The creamy texture leads to a honeyed finish.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2001 Belle Terre Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This is a winemaker's wine. The underlying fruit flavors are tight, suggesting tart green apples and barely ripened peaches; smoky oak has added buttery, creamy notes. A very good candidate at the dinner table.
title: Baileyana 2001 Firepeak Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: What a juicy, tasty Chard this is. It's classic Russian River, with its flavors of tart green apples veering into ripe peach and pear, and that sleek backbone of minerality. Well-oaked with smoky, spicy wood, adding to the complexity. The texture is rich and smooth.
title: X 2000 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Textbook Santa Maria Chard, with its rich flavors of mango, papaya and pineapple. The acidity is high, making for a tartness through the finish, but oak softens and adds smoky cream and vanilla and a smooth roundness. Satisfying and pleasant all the way through.
title: Byron 2000 Nielson Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A delicious wine that bodes well for the vintage. Filled with flavors of ripe tropical fruits, peaches and pears, vanilla and buttered toast, in a creamy texture perked up with crisp acidity. Finishes with a smoky, spicy aftertaste.
title: Valley of the Moon 2002 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Superripe and gooey with tropical fruit. Bursting with mango, pineapple, guava, orange, roasted hazelnut, buttered toast, vanilla and smoke, in a custardy texture that's smooth and refined. Finishes dry, with a lingering flavor of orange and spice.
title: Château Souverain 2001 Winemaker's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: From vines planted in 1967, a lush, complex wine, with peach flavors giving way to dried apricot, hazelnut, flowers and herbs, and a suggestion of brittle autumn leaves in the finish. Round, creamy and opulent on the palate, with a smoky, vanilla edge, it's a fascinating wine that shows how good Chard can be with a little bottle age.
title: Fritz 2000 Shop Block Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Rich, with a tangy range of flavors from tart green apples through pears and peaches and a hint of pineapple. Well-balanced with creamy, smoky oak, bracing acidity and dusty brown spices. Picks up a honeyed, resinous quality in the long finish.
title: Chalk Hill 2000 Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: A well-crafted Chard, rich and balanced. The mango and pineapple flavors are elaborated with smoky, spicy, buttery notes from oak and lees, and the creamy mouthfeel is a delight. Brims with a youthful acidity.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2001 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The grapes got really ripe this vintage, and the aromas and flavors are of tropical fruits, like guava and mango. The oak has been lavishly applied, with add smoky vanillins and buttered toast. This is a big, flamboyant wine, but skillfully vinified, and good acidity keeps things bright and crisp.
title: Raymond 2001 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The winemaker calls this wine "minerally," and it's true thatit's not a ripely opulent Chard, although there are some pleasant tropical fruit flavors along with the herbs and stones. But mainly this is a firm wine, well-oaked, with bracing acidity. Turns a bit sharp on the finish.
title: Newton 2000 Unfiltered Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: I like this Chardonnay for its streamlined green apple flavors, which have been tarted up as much as possible by  lots of new oak and sur lies aging. These contribute creamy, smoky and sweet and sour cream nuances to an acidic wine obviously built for food, rather than by-itself hedonism.
title: Sterling 2001 Winery Lake Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Lovely and inviting, a well-structured wine due to its good acids and sprinkling of dusty tannins. The flavors are a bit tight, suggesting riper, sweeter citrus fruits such as tangerines, and the texture is rich and creamy.
title: Rutz 2000 Maison Grand Cru Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Bright, crisp and really likeable, not just another me-too oaky monster. Well-etched fruity flavors of tart green apples, nectarine and guava are balanced with brilliant acids and just the right amount of smoky oak barrels. The spicy finish goes on for a long time.
title: Rutz 2000 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A lush, opulent Chard marked by oaky aromas and flavors. The underlying flavors are of tropical fruits, enhanced with vanilla, buttered toast and smoky spices. Drinks very rich and flamboyant; a show-off wine.
title: Hess Collection 2001 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Has all the hallmarks of lush fruit, plus soft but adequate acidity, with a rich coat of oak. Flatters the palate with a creamy intensity and a long, fruity finish.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2000 Robert Young Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This is from the vineyard that Helen Turley originally made famous under her Marcassin label, from vines that are slowly succumbing to phylloxera (winemaker Westrick says that 2003 may be the last vintage before replanting). It's the biggest and most explosive Chardonnay from Stonestreet, with smoke and toast backed by oranges, peaches and hints of hazelnut and a rich, custardy mouthfeel.
title: Stonestreet 2000 Upper Barn Chardonnay (Green Valley)
Hartford 2000 Stone Côte Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Almost always distinctive, and this year has unusual flair and finesse. Shows a Chablisian style of mineral, warm stone, and citrus, but with far richer streaks, like gold embedded in flint. Oak and lees are elegantly applied. More foodworthy than most California Chards.
title: Bernardus 2001 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: A flamboyant Chard, packed with tropical fruit flavors and with a lavish overlay of smoky oak. Drinks crisp and clean in the mouth, with a creamy texture and a long, spicy finish. Could use a bit more finesse and subtlety, but glamorous and enticing.
title: Cambria 2000 Rae's Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Clearly an older wine, picking up a bottle bouquet of dried herbs, lees and yeast, riding on top of basic peach, pear and tropical fruits. Drinks very dry and crisp. The fruit is beginning to fade, leaving behind flavors of dried leaves, herbs, minerals and spice. An interesting wine of considerable nuance and subtlety.
designation: FOS Reserve Gravelstone Vineyard - Est. Res. Collection
title: Jekel 1999 FOS Reserve Gravelstone Vineyard - Est. Res. Collection Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A smooth, classy Chardonnay, this wine strikes a fine balance between elegance and strength. Framed in toasty oak, it shows off plenty of pretty citrus, pear, apple and herb flavors, finishing clean and long with a mineral edge.
