description: This is a flashy Chardonnay, marked by scads of oak that contributes buttered toast and vanilla cream. You find rich fruit flavors of pineapples and golden mangoes, but they struggle to overcome the barrel influence. Still, there's no denying the opulence. Drink now.
title: Vine Cliff 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: With this 2008, Taz brings to the table a wonderful Chardonnay at a great price. It's dry and crisply acidic, with bright, perky flavors of oranges, peaches, Meyer lemons and smoky vanilla. Really nice and clean, a lovely wine and a good restaurant by-the-glass selection. Production was 9,000 cases.
title: Taz 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A very nice Chardonnay for this price. It's barrel fermented and aged on the lees in the classic style, which gives smoky, creamy notes to the underlying pineapple, green apple, Meyer lemon and orange flavors. Vibrant Carneros acidity makes for a clean finish. Easy to find, with 13,000 cases produced.
title: Saintsbury 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Some will criticize this Chardonnay for being too oaky and sweet, but it sure is delicious. It just brims with pineapple, yellow apricot, crème brûlée, honey and buttered toast flavors that are balanced with crisp acidity. If you like that California style, you'll love this opulent wine.
title: Foxen 2009 Tinaquaic Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Made in a Chablis style, this Chardonnay is bone dry and crisp in acidity. The pineapple and peach flavors are integrated with stony minerals. It's not a complex wine, but is super-clean and zesty, a nice complement to shellfish, mushroom risotto or a perfectly roasted chicken.
title: Bearboat 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This enormously rich Chardonnay was grown in the winery's dramatic mountain vineyard. It's powerful in concentrated pineapple jam and lemon fruit, while winemaker interventions add creamy notes of vanilla, honey and buttered toast. What it trades in nuance, it more than makes up for in sheer power.
title: Hess Collection 2008 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Made in the oaky-fruity style that makes some Chardonnays cloying, but saved by brisk acidity and a steely minerality that must come from chalk and rocks in the soil. The flavors are of pineapples and tangerines.
title: Sanford 2008 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Shows the upfront fruit and oak of the popular style of Chardonnay, but earns extra points for dryness, acidity, creaminess and minerality. The fruit veers toward delicious pineapples. Drink now with rich shellfish, Ahi tuna, lobster risotto.
title: Martin Ray 2008 Reserve Bald Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: The cool vintage has given this Chardonnay a steely, minerally austerity, like Chablis. Its pedigreed origins and superior winemaking are evident in the overall balance. Dry and crisp in acidity, it's a racy wine, with stone-licked citrus, apricot and peach flavors.
title: Molnar Family 2008 Poseidon's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Made without any oak influences, this wine shows the splendors of great Santa Maria Chardonnay. It's marked by complex flavors of Meyer lemons, pineapples, orange zest and honeysuckle, and is beautifully bright in crisp acidity. Nice with fresh crab.
title: Dierberg 2008 Steel Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A good, drily tart, Chablis-style Chardonnay, with crisp acidity and stony minerality. Shows interesting flavors of pineapples, tangerines, honeysuckle and cinnamon spice.
title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2008 DeMayo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: A very good, useful Chardonnay that's easy to drink, yet also quite complex. Brisk and crisp in acidity, it shows citrus mineral, green apple and floral notes, touched with smoky oak.
title: MacRostie 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Very forward in fruit, offering a powerful wave of pineapples, oranges, lemons, limes and peaches. Fortunately, all this richness is dry, and brightened with crisp, tart acidity. Suggests a rich lobster or shrimp risotto.
title: Iron Horse 2008 Estate Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: There's no oak on this Chardonnay, but it's so rich, you don't even notice. It's all pure, ripe pineapple, orange and lime fruit, accompanied by tart, clean Green Valley acidity. Tremendously versatile with food.
title: Iron Horse 2008 UnOaked Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: A beautiful Chardonnay notable for its food-friendliness. Strikes a firm path toward dryness and minerality, with suggestions of citrus, peach and vanilla. The racy acidity is wonderful. Defines elegance in Chardonnay, at a good price.
title: Paul Dolan 2008 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: A beautiful Chardonnay at a great price compared to what's out there. Shows brilliantly ripe pineapple, pear and guava flavors, with crisp Central Coast acidity and a bracing minerality. Nice to drink by itself, with shellfish or even with a citrus fruit pastry for dessert.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2008 Flood Family Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: A very good Chardonnay, fancy and elegant, although it's a little sharp in the mouth, and lacks a certain hedonistic appeal, especially at this price. Shows dry, oak-inspired flavors of pineapples, green apples and pears, with a firm minerality.
title: Iron Horse 2008 Corral Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: A big improvement over the 2007, Stephens' '08 is rich and ripe. It brims with pineapple, buttered toast, vanilla and cinnamon flavors, brightened with crisp acidity. Easy to drink, and delicious through the finish.
title: D.R. Stephens 2008 Estate Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A nice, lush Chardonnay. It lacks a bit of exciting structure, and depends too much on sheer dazzle. But it sure is rich in toasty oak-inspired pineapples, peaches, pears and limes. Good now with grilled shrimp.
title: Bernardus 2008 Ingrid's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carmel Valley)

description: A lean, steely and slightly herbaceous Chardonnay, whose brisk elegance makes up for the absence of richness. This Chablis-style wine is marked by minerals and suggestions of lemons and limes, as well as strong acidity. Calls for fresh crab in the shell, with plenty of drawn butter for dipping.
title: Fontanella 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Absolutely beautiful, one of the best unoaked Chardonnays on the market. Brims with bright, clean flavors of pineapples, limes and kiwis, along with vanilla and a touch of cinnamon spice. With its brisk scour of acidity, it's a super-drinkable wine.
title: Roche 2009 Stainless Steel Fermented Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A flamboyant Chardonnay. Shows flashy scents of vanilla and buttered toast from oak, riding high over pineapple, pear, golden mango and nectarine fruit. Crisp acidity provides needed balance to the richness. Good price for the quality.
title: Wild Horse 2008 Unbridled Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A bit overt in oak, with vanilla and buttered toast aromas and flavors dominating. But you'll also find rich, flamboyant notes of pineapples, kiwi fruit and limes. Fancy and elegant, with broad restaurant appeal.
title: Longoria 2008 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Shows the slight tug of herbaceousness that often marks Carneros/Napa Chardonnays. But it's very dry and crisp, and there's a minerality that helps this lemon- and lime-flavored wine pair cleanly with shellfish, salmon or just a good roast chicken.
title: Cuvaison 2008 ATS Selection Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Good price for an upscale Chardonnay this rich and interesting. It's oaky, with vanilla and buttered toast flavors, but the underlying pineapple and Meyer lemon fruit easily supports the wood, while brisk, refreshing acidity provides balance.
title: Mercy 2008 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Shows lots of dryness and austerity, with acidity, minerals and herbs accompanying the citrus and oak flavors. Not a flamboyant Chardonnay, but a controlled one that offers complexity. A good companion to fresh crab, with buttery garlic bread.
title: Magness 2008 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A very nice Chardonnay that's dry and crisp and elegant. Shows tart, leesy flavors of citrus fruits, apricots and pears, with a steely minerality that may come from those famous Livermore rocks. Great price for a Chardonnay of this quality.
title: Concannon 2008 Conservancy Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Shows the brisk, tart acidity that always shows up in wines from this little Central Coast appellation. Also demonstrates the bright flavors of limes, kiwis and pineapples that mark an Edna Valley Chardonnay. Not subtle, but deliciously drinkable.
title: Tolosa 2007 Edna Ranch 1772 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: A really good Chardonnay that shows the classic acidity and dryness of the Sonoma Coast, with complex, pleasurable flavors. Pineapples, pears, apricots and guavas are the fruits, enriched with sweet oak, in a dry, balanced and elegant wine that could develop bottle nuance over the next 2-4 years.
title: Fogdog 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Good price for such a nice Chardonnay from the Santa Rita Hills. The wine is very dry and crisp in acidity, with a bracing mouthfeel that offers rich, oak-inspired flavors of pineapples, pears and green apples. Nice now with Ahi tuna tartare or grilled salmon.
title: Lafond 2007 SRH Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A wonderfully drinkable Chardonnay that shows brilliant coastal character and lots of richness, at a decent price. Crisp and dry, it has elaborate flavors of pineapples, green apples, peaches, crème brûlée, buttered toast, vanilla and cinnamon spice.
title: Schug 2008 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Very dry, crisp and minerally, a subtle wine with some bottle age that shows real complexity and finesse. Not for fruit-forward fans, its pineapple, pear and herb flavors are drying out, leading to interesting, old-wine, honey-and-cashew nuances. Drink right away, before it dies.
title: Hopper Creek 2006 Los Chamizal Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: A beautifully elegant, refined Chardonnay. Because it's not overloaded with oak, it displays the basic finesse of the grapes from this cool-climate vineyard. Crisp and dry, it's rich and complex in citrus, tropical fruit, peach, mineral and honeysuckle flavors, at a fair price.
title: Artesa 2008 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a dry Chardonnay marked by pronounced acids and steely minerals. The underlying flavors are of exotic pineapples and guavas, while new oak and lees aging add richer notes of buttered toast and sour cream. Drink now.
title: Baileyana 2007 Grand Firepeak Cuvée Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: There's a flowery note to this Chardonnay, which is dry, crisply acidic and strong in flavor in its youth. Brims with pineapple tart filling, Key lime pie, orange zest, honeysuckle, daffodil and smoky, vanilla-oak flavors, with a creamy, yeasty richness. Would benefit from greater restraint and subtlety, which may come after 3-5 years in the bottle. If you drink it now, give it a good decanting.
title: Marimar Estate 2007 La Masía Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of oak on this crisply acidic wine, which is dominated by vanilla, buttered toast and caramel. Underneath all that is a crisp, fruity wine featuring pineapples, peaches, pears and green apples. May come together by mid-2010.
title: Roessler 2007 Alder Springs Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Rich and oaky, with a golden color suggesting the oak that has been lavished on the pineapple, green apple and pear fruit flavors of the grapes. Barrels have provided richer layers of buttered toast and caramel. This is an exotic, dramatic Chardonnay, although it perhaps trades subtlety for opulence.
title: Mi Sueño 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a richly layered, tropical white wine that offers flavors of sweet oak, mango and pineapple. These fruit flavors are concentrated on the palate, balanced by well-honed acidity and underlying freshness.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Smashed lemon rinds, sandalwood oil, split pine logs and a touch of toast show on the nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard. It's fresh on the palate with a sharp citrusy edge, which cuts through the fuller bodied midpalate flavors of pineapple and melon.
title: Fess Parker 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Heady in voluptuous up-front oak, this wine's rich full-bodied character continues with a taste of brioche and caramel apple. The creaminess on the palate is met by buoyant underlying acidity.
title: Frostwatch 2015 Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

description: This offers tremendous value. It is oaky on the nose and voluptuously balanced in green apple, citrus and fresh uplifting acidity. The freshness and lightness win the day and make this a food-friendly deliciously balanced wine.
title: Starmont 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Sugary vanilla seasons baked pineapple flavors in this full-bodied concentrated white that's fleshy and plush in richness. The layers are robustly structured to hold up to the fruit, with a supportive backbone of toasted oak.
title: Mi Sueño 2015 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: From a site in the Sebastopol Hills, this wine offers up-front acidity and freshness, with a floral flourish of rose garden and lavender. On the palate it becomes velvety and exotic in nutmeg and cardamom, the fruit, oak and acidity integrated well.
title: Ladera 2015 Pillow Road Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dark gold in color and marked by a sweetness of oak, this wine is intensely layered and full bodied, an explosively powerful combination of pineapple, baked apple and lemon custard.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2015 Robert Young Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This is made from grapes grown within the Petaluma Gap, now an appellation of its own. Heady notions of apple and pear rise on the nose, with seasonings of nutmeg and butterscotch emanating from the toasted oak. The lemon-curd-like richness is well-contained.
title: Clouds Rest 2014 Allure Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: From Cat Canyon vineyard and aged in neutral French oak, this bottling is tightly wound on the nose, with restrained aromas of white peach, nectarine, pineapple and lemon rind. There's a touch of almond paste to the sip, then come fresh lemon wedges and buttered nuts in the finish.
title: Parker 2015 Los Alamos Valley Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Lemon cream, peach and mango show on the nose of this top-tier bottling from the historic regional producer. The flavors are light and bright, with lemon juice and apple flesh, though the wine feels a bit more reserved in this vintage.
title: Morgan 2016 Double L Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: For fans of a bigger voluptuous style, this wine delivers a lush layered combination of honeycomb and crème brûlée. Dark in color, the oak is pronounced and supportive, while the structure is moderate, opting for velvety texture and rich ripe fruit.
title: B Cellars 2015 Star Vineyard Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: The longtime Rhône variety-focused winery is expanding into Burgundian varieties, and this first Chardonnay is a solid start. Aromas of lime, white melon, wet stone and a touch of guava lean toward a richer expression. The palate is rounded with clotted cream, salt and lemon zest flavors, balancing between the buttery Californian and tenser Old World styles.
title: Jaffurs 2015 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There's a compelling fatness to the nose of this bottling, with broad aromas of nectarine, banana and coconut. That tropicality is present in the palate, with flavors of plumeria and coconut cream, but it's dialed back by a zesty lemon-edged acidity. Both rich and racy, this will appeal to many Chardonnay lovers.
title: Boekenoogen 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a delicious, no-nonsense wine that features pure fruit flavors, little obvious oak influence, good zingy acidity and excellent balance. Its strength is a slight sense of reserve that is refreshing and mouthwatering.
title: FEL 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This appealing and medium-bodied wine has a light earthy, buttery aroma and plenty of butter, lemon and vanilla flavors underpinned by good, lively acidity that keeps it fresh through the finish.
title: Carpe Diem 2015 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This wine has a feral aspect to it-a mix of wild mushroom and gritty stone, with the grit and grip persistent on the palate. Asian pear, apple and nutmeg highlight a full-bodied concentration nuanced in toasted oak.
title: Ram's Gate 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This lovely and lingering white impresses from start to finish, showing a wealth of pear and peach flavors within an inviting jasmine aroma. It finishes in swift teases of wild vanilla and subtle oak.
title: Raeburn 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an affordable crowd-pleasing white, bright, clean and medium bodied, with some heft from the oak. Made in a creamy textured style, it's grainy and full of apple and crème brûlée flavor.
title: Gundlach Bundschu 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Caramel apple and big-boned oak show upfront richness in this boldly concentrated white from a Ulises Valdez-farmed site. Intense and robust, its underlying acidity complements and refreshes.
title: Friedeman 2015 UV Lancel Creek Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Creamy thick, sultry and savory, this is a small-production wine made to impress and provide impact, which it does well. Baked apple pie dusted in cardamom is the lingering reward, buoyed in medium acidity and an armful of toasted oak.
title: MacRostie 2015 The Key Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Focused, fresh acidity rules the day in this well-made wine made from Kirk Venge. Aromas and flavors of pineapple, white flower and golden oak meld together to offer a lush yet balanced experience.
title: Jax 2016 Dutton Ranch 7 Barrels Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made as a block and barrel selection, this white is meant to highlight some of the producer's oldest and most concentrated vines. It does, offering a confection of oaky vanilla and marshmallow on the nose before concentrated textures of soft sublime apple and peach meet lasting acidity.
title: Cuvaison 2015 Adda Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Tropical tones of mango and pineapple are vibrant in this wine. It is taut, with intense acidity that settles into toasty oak. Vibrantly focused, it has a core of vanilla and Meyer lemon that comes through on the finish atop a hint of butterscotch.
title: Kunde 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Concentrated essences of honeysuckle and lily pair up with orange oil and a touch of nuttiness on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's zippy on the lively palate, showing smashed walnut and seared lemon-wedge flavors.
title: Crawford Family 2015 Tin Shack Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Salty and briny around a fruity core of green apple and Meyer lemon meringue, this approachable white is full bodied and wholly concentrated, with plenty of integrated oak. A steely ring of acidity keeps it from becoming too rich, with a finish nicely polished in vanilla.
title: Chalk Hill 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Crisp notions of yellow apple and pear meet integrated acidity and balanced oak in this white. With a firmness to the mouthfeel, it has the structure and approachability that will please a broad range of palates.
title: Martin Ray 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: This wine is delightfully smooth as it delivers moderate fruit, butter and almond flavors on a rich-feeling yet light texture. It coats the palate from the first sip through to the mild, lingering finish.
title: Moniker 2016 La Ribera Vineyard Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: With a backbone of well-defined acidity, this coastal white is creamy in texture, with highlights of fig, pear and toasted oak. Juicy and likable, it lingers in a vanilla wafer tone.
title: Flowers 2015 Camp Meeting Ridge Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Dark gold in color, this is from a fantastic, famous vineyard site in the heart of the appellation. Confectionery aromas give it a welcoming richness and lush character that's hard to resist. Green olive, vanilla and pineapple shine brightly alongside caramel crème brûlée and toasted oak.
title: Merry Edwards 2014 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Reduced, with a spritzy underbelly of acidity, this wine lands fresh and vibrant in dried herb and green apple, with a medium-bodied ripeness and use of oak.
title: Benziger 2015 Signaterra West Rows Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: This wine has a crispness on entry that develops a fleshy texture and medium-bodied weight on the midpalate. Subdued notions of apple, pear and pineapple ply a vibrant layering of stony acidity, with a finish of richer honeycomb.
title: La Pitchoune 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Roasted nuts, hot buttered toast with lemon preserves, sea salt and a touch of chalk show on the layered nose of this bottling by winemaker Sabrine Rodems. The flavors are classical and clean, with lemon wedge, cashew, more salt and a hint of butterscotch, all riding atop a strong acidity.
title: Wrath 2015 3 Clone Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Don Van Staaveren is the winemaker of this well-crafted wine, sourced from Rodger's Creek Vineyard in the Petaluma Gap area. Opulent on the nose, it follows up in richness and robust flavors of toasted oak and apple, finishing awash in butterscotch.
title: Silverpoint Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This unoaked wine always impresses, offering sweetly floral tones on the nose and a wealth of tropical mango and pineapple on the palate. Steely, with some bristling citrus-driven acidity, it's refreshing and focused, with hints of lemongrass.
title: Marimar Estate 2016 Acero Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine opens with a confectionery hint of marshmallow and caramel before showing its more steely underbelly of fresh, focused acidity. Funky apple, nutmeg and lemongrass figure into the medium-bodied mix, a complement of savory and fruit.
title: La Pitchoune 2014 Pratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Very light in the glass, this twist-top bottling offers tight and bright aromas of white rose petals, citrus peel and cold steel on the nose. The palate is much more exciting, with lime zest, baked nectarine, lemongrass and a hint of marshmallow, all set against a chalky structure.
title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Zoto Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a bold wine, showing smoky, toasted oak aromas to bolster ripe pear and apple flavors that are accented by vanilla and cream. It's not something delicate for fresh seafood, but will taste great with a roast chicken or pizza bianco.
title: The Federalist 2016 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Intensely oaky and robustly built, this young white mellows in the glass to reveal a voluptuous citrus core. It offers vibrancy on the finish that plays well against bold flavors of pear and melon.
title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: Dark in color and consisting of considerable oak, this wine is sublime in texture, with aromas of matchstick and floral apple blossom. Savory in apple pie and cinnamon, it has elegance and impressive length.
title: Glenwood Cellars 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Textured in baked apple and pear flavors, this wine is ultimately creamy and lush, with a rounded approach to oak. A tautness in structure helps keep it fresh, with a lovely floral undertone on the bouquet.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Fiorella Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an exotic, elegant and restrained coastal wine, that is tart with lemon and lemongrass. Light and bright, its texture is fluffy and creamy, with a lingering hint of biscotti.
title: Bailarin 2016 Black Knight Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Well-balanced, this coastal wine is deftly integrated in acidity and floral aromas of apple blossom. Its exotic flavor profile leans into quince, fig and classic Gravenstein apple.
title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: With a breath of matchstick on entry, this wine is ultimately juicy and gritty in texture, with a persistent backbeat of toasty oak. Ripe apple and papaya mix well to offer a tropical creaminess.
title: Buena Vista 2015 Jovita's Selection Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Buttery, rich and creamily lush, this wine is robust and in tropical and stone fruit flavor, with a side note of green olive that makes it intriguing and memorable.
title: Bennett Lane 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: This is a juicy and full-bodied white, tightly woven in oak and butterscotch. Expansive on the palate, with a depth of apple pie and nutmeg, it offers a balance of fresh acidity that complements well.
title: Buena Vista 2015 Natalia's Selection Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Deep hay in color, this wine is full bodied and creamy, with well-integrated layers of pineapple, papaya and green olive. Toasted oak supports the fruitiness and floral aromas.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Dominique Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: An approachable, accessible and high quality wine, this offers flavors of crème brûlée seasoned in anise. It is a rich round expression of the variety that has an additional depth of baked apple and toasted oak.
title: De Loach 2015 OFS Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Candied lemon peel, walnut, cashew and balsam aromas show on the rich nose of this bottling from a vineyard just east of the Pacific Ocean behind Cambria. The palate is viscous with flavors of lemon syrup and orange rind.
title: Stolo 2015 Estate Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Big oak and a touch of reduction show through on the nose of this appellation wine, as full-figured flavors of crème brûlée, pineapple and Gravenstein applesauce play along a gravelly texture. Highlights of nutmeg and ginger spice the fruit well.
title: Buena Vista 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Butterscotch candies, lime spritz, concentrated honeysuckle and strong praline aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate combines salted butter, orange rind and white peach, with hints of white pepper, chamomile and smoke.
title: Talley 2015 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Opening with beautiful aromatics, this wine has a heady invitation of orange and apple blossom before revealing a sublime texture and rich oak. Pillowy on the palate, it offers Asian pear and apple flavors, with a slight confectionery quality of crème brûlée.
title: La Crema 2015 Saralee's Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a slight, lithe line of butterscotch on the nose of this bottling, with lots of lemon blossoms and Meyer lemon juice overshadowing the buttery aspect. The palate is tart in green apple and Anjou pear flavors, followed by honeydew and white peach.
title: Point & Line 2015 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine offers attractive layers of green apple built around a lush palate of pear and tropical pineapple. Its richness is met by complementary structure, balance and a subdued construct of oak that supports without distraction.
title: Hess 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tart ripe pineapple is given a caramel flip of richness and concentration in this lush integrated wine, that is heady in oak and made in a voluptuous style.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is an estate-grown white, unfettered by oak, that opts instead to focus on floral apple-blossom aromas and bright, fresh flavors of tangerine and grapefruit zest. A bite of green apple shines on the finish.
designation: Teresa's Unoaked Estate Grown Estate Bottled
title: Balletto 2016 Teresa's Unoaked Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Stone, lime salt and lemon zest pique the entry of this medium-bodied white, which is well-integrated in terms of oak. High in citrus flavor and pear, it has a gritty texture that gives it added complexity.
title: Kokomo 2015 Peters Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a very good example of an unoaked Chardonnay. It has lots of zingy fresh-fruit aromas, lively citrus and green-apple flavors and good supportive acidity to keep the mouthfeel tangy. Winemaker Karl Wente made this one to please his no-frills dad, Eric Wente.
title: Wente 2016 Eric's Small Lot Unoaked Estate Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: With a Good & Plenty candy nose of anise, this is a warm, thick, rich and concentrated white wine, intensely crafted to highlight crème brûlée and baked pear. The style is full-bodied and ripe.
title: Titus 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Within an intense cradling of oak, this wine offers big flavors of green apple and toasted vanilla. Full bodied and richly concentrated, it settles into a balanced mineral-laden place of gravelly texture.
title: Cuvaison 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The fifth generation certainly got it right. This wine is more savory than fruity, as earth and oak flavors highlight the aromas while baking spices and almond flavors soothe the palate. It's smooth and lush in texture and not too heavy in body. Drink now.
title: Gen5 2015 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Made from Robert Young-cloned grapes, this wine is perfumed in exotic lychee and briny, salty oak. Fulsome flavors of apple skin are generously expansive on the full-bodied palate.
title: Mira 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a rich and well-balanced wine in which tempting vanilla and other baking spices are backed by crisp and ripe apple and pear flavors, and followed by a lingering, marzipan finish.
title: Spicy Vines 2015 Foggy Mountain Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Moderate in oak and well-structured, this estate-grown wine is subdued and classy, with defined layers of green olive, juicy apple and lemongrass, a tiny hint of jalapeño adding a touch of spice. Food-friendly, it'll complement a versatile range of dishes.
title: Truchard 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Richly soft, round and concentrated, this wine is exuberant in apple flavor, with a touch of stone fruit and papaya. It has a pleasing succulence that should broadly appeal.
title: Landmark 2015 Overlook Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Voluptuously lush and creamy, this is thick in vanilla swirls and crème brûlée, with full-bodied concentration of baked apple. Rich and round, it finishes in a yeasty tone of brioche.
designation: Jose S. Ferrer Estate Reserve Selection
title: Gloria Ferrer 2015 Jose S. Ferrer Estate Reserve Selection Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The nose on this single-vineyard bottling is mellow at first but then allows very complex, nearly nose-tickling aromas of lemon peel, lime sorbet, Marcona almond and white peach to emerge. The sip starts crisp and clean before the more opulent white peach and honeysuckle flavors blend with a pinch of sea salt.
title: Tantara 2015 Tondre Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Restrained on the nose at first, this appellation blend shows lemon, butter on brioche and gardenia aromas with some swirling. It's floral on the unctuous palate, with hints of honeysuckle and daffodil, but quite rounded, with soft acidity and textural grip. A flash of coconut hits the finish.
title: Joullian 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Floral jasmine and apple blossom notes are inviting in this wine, which offers a seamless palate of lush apple, pear and stone fruit flavors. The fruity midpalate evolves into a smooth finish of nutmeg spice.
title: Flora Springs 2016 Family Select Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Nicely integrated, this large production wine is a fantastic deal for the quality, delivering layers of apple and Meyer lemon flavors within a frame of juicy acidity and balanced oak. A tease of nutmeg-dusted apricot lingers on the finish.
title: Artesa 2015 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Fleshy and briny, this wine hails from the producer's own marquee vineyard, situated in the heart of the Olivet Lane district. Ripe, with a buttery undertone, it's classic in its rendering of Gravenstein apple and pear flavors-balanced, yet with a robust frame.
title: Pellegrini 2014 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This new offering from the sparkling wine producer reveals strongly crafted layers of creamy apple pie, crème brûlée and toasty oak flavors. Made in a full-bodied, concentrated style, it doesn't hold back on its spicy acidity and lemony finish.
title: WindVane 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a bright, effusive, full-bodied wine, with underlying acidity that keeps it fresh in the glass. Apple and pear flavors combine with firm texture, providing weight and breadth.
title: Trione 2015 River Road Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This larger production offering from the respected producer is a testament to the benefit of sourcing from multiple sites. It showcases an interesting oyster shell note, as well as robust, caramelized oak. Honey and baked apple flavors lend richness and concentration.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Caramelized apple and vanilla notes give this wine a rich, concentrated personality. With its full-bodied embrace of bold, ripe flavor, it delivers layers of spice and oak, supported by juicy acidity.
title: David Bruce 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This voluptuous wine offers concentrated golden honey, baked apricot and pear notes, with integrated oak. Made in a full-bodied, creamy style that's hard to resist, it has a looming acidity that works behind the scenes to provide balance.
title: Belden Barns 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: This estate-grown white from an organically farmed vineyard has a reduced note of sulfur that blows off with time. It opens to reveal layers of crisp Golden Delicious apple, tropical papaya and honey. Moderate acidity buoys the freshness, providing respite from its lush core.
title: Grgich Hills 2015 Miljenko's Selection Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This wine's thick and buttery aromas range from cashew cream and caramel to honeysuckle and Maui onion. Its powerful acidity cuts through the palate's unctuous and oily qualities, with buttercream and lemon juice flavors combining for a big personality.
title: Scott Family 2015 Dijon Clone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Highly floral, this is a light-styled wine with integrated oak. Its apple blossom aroma is delightfully inviting, leading to strong lemon, vanilla and apple pie flavors that play on the lush, creamy palate.
title: Migration 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Creamy but not overly buttery aromas meet with Anjou pear, honeysuckle and marcona almond notes on the nose of this popular bottling from one of the region's stalwart producers. The palate combines nutty qualities with lemon peel and sharply acidic apple flavors.
title: Morgan 2015 Highland Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This desirable appellation wine hails from several well-farmed vineyards, including the producer's hillside Wildcat Mountain site in the Petaluma Gap. Apple blossom aromas lead to a taut body of ripe, balanced fruit-an exploration of pineapple and mango that's food-friendly, with high-toned acidity.
title: MacRostie 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A melodious medley of tropical fruit and peach, this is a robustly ripe and oaky expression of the site in a warm year. It's round and medium bodied, settling in the glass to show balance and refinement. A crisp green apple note shines on the finish.
title: Ocean's Churning 2014 Sangiacomo Green Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A bittersweet apple element gives this wine an intellectual component, tempering its richer crème brûlée-like flavors. Medium-bodied, with crisp acidity, it shows off the estate vineyard site well, in a well-regarded vintage.
designation: Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled
title: Balletto 2014 Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Clarified butter and lemon rind notes combine on the entry of this estate-grown wine. Spicy, salty acidity and a subdued crisp-apple flavor contribute to its light, tangy finish.
designation: Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled
title: Balletto 2014 Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a distinct suggestion of citrus pith on the nose of this bottling, along with tight almond and sea salt aromas. The palate leads with a touch of ripeness, but finds a firm structure and chalky backbone, proving rather racy, albeit with hazelnut-like richness. A well polished wine.
title: Grevino 2014 Estate Vineyards Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Baked pineapple and heady creme brûlée scents follow through to the palate of this wine in rich, concentrated waves of flavor. Textured and lush through the midpalate, it finishes with bright, refreshing acidity.
title: Knights Bridge 2015 Pont De Chevalier Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: Fresh squeezed lime, apple cider and wet stone aromas meet with a touch of mulling spice on the nose of this appellation blend, which is excellently priced. The palate is clean and crisp, with pear and lime flavors as well as a touch of salt.
title: Gainey 2015 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Crisp coastal acidity makes this Chardonnay shine. It shows ripe flavors of pineapples, peaches and apricots, with oaky influences adding vanilla and buttered toast. Ready now.
title: Roessler 2007 Clos Pepe Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Very rich in ripe fruit and oak. Shows lavish flavors of pineapple tart, sour pineapple candy, vanilla cookie and elaborate Asian spices, with a touch of butterscotch. This is a fancy, palate-grabbing Chardonnay.
title: Mi Sueño 2007 Pugash Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Still tastes fresh and vital at the age of three years, no doubt due to the brisk acidity that makes the wine so clean. The flavors are ripe and complex, suggesting pineapples and Meyer lemons, made richer by the vanilla and buttercream of lees and smoky oak. Now-2011.
title: Martin Ray 2006 Heintz Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a high acid, dry and minerally Chardonnay that you can call Chablisian. It has flavors of grilled lemons, limes and pineapples, with richer notes of sweet oak and lees and the buttered toast of oak. Defined by elegance, it should develop bottle complexities over the next three or four years.
title: Pine Ridge 2007 Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A very nice, elegant Chardonnay that shows plenty of creamy, oaky richness of pineapples, limes and pears, but also a crisp streak of acidity and minerality that provides grounding and balance. A good example of Russian River precision.
title: Herzog 2007 Special Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Three-plus years in the bottle have been kind to this Chardonnay. It's mellowed, and the primary fruit pineapple, pear and tropical fruit flavors are beginning to develop bottle complexities, giving the wine a spicy, nutty, minerally complexity. Beautiful now-2011.
title: RustRidge 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The vineyard is far better known for powerful, concentrated Pinot Noir, and this Chardonnay shares those characteristics. It's a big, fruity wine, not showing much finesse, but plenty of sheer magnitude. Brims with tropical fruit, apple, exotic spice and oak flavors that finish dry. Could do interesting things over the years.
title: Morgan 2007 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a strong Chardonnay. Strong in ripe fruit, in acidity and in oak. It offers massive waves of grilled pineapples, buttered toast, vanilla and tangy minerals. A bit overbearing now, but could benefit from a few years in the cellar.
title: Breggo 2007 Savoy Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: If you're looking for a more acidic, balanced and minerally Chardonnay, this one's for you. It's crisp and streamlined, but doesn't compromise on flavor, offering tiers of pineapple, papaya, ripe white peach and golden nectarine, made richer with smoky oak.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2007 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ripe and oaky. May fall a bit short on complexity and finesse, but makes up for it in sheer power. Pineapple crème brûlée, spicy green apple butter, ripe pear, Asian spices and smoky oak are the flavors, backed with firm acidity.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A lovely Chardonnay, delicate and minerally, with luscious flavors of flowers, citrus fruits, Asian pears, vanilla and spice. Complex and easy to like.
title: Saintsbury 2007 Unfiltered Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The yeasty aroma and taste of lees and the sweet caramel of new oak dominate this single-vineyard Chardonnay, making it a little heavy. Yet it has enormous flavors of pineapples, green apples and Asian pears. Seems young and unintegrated, but could knit together and gain bottle complexity by mid-2010.
title: De Loach 2007 Hawk Hill Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Orogeny has a very good track record with their Chardonnay, and they've held back on the price, which is good news for consumers. The '07 is oaky and ripe, with pineapple tart, pear jam, green apple butter, honey, vanilla cream and smoky cedar flavors.
title: Orogeny 2007 Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: A beautiful Chardonnay and, at this price, a great bargain. Shows Chablis-like dryness and minerality and an elegantly crisp mouthfeel, with flavors of pineapple, vanilla and charred oak. Only 4,000 cases, but worth a search, especially by sommeliers for a by-the-glass program.
title: Educated Guess 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Bright and clean, this Chard has some toasty new oak, which adds smoky, buttered toast and vanilla cream notes to the green apples, pears and minerals. Very nice, and zesty in acidity.
title: Rusack 2007 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Made in an accessible, pleasing fashion, with sweet, smoky oak framing ripe flavors of pineapples, pears and honey. Easy to find, with 6,169 cases produced.
title: Byron 2007 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: An elegant Chardonnay to drink now with a wide variety of food, everything from shellfish and grilled salmon to roast chicken and veal. Bone dry and crisply tart, it shows a stony minerality, with flavors of Meyer lemons, pears and peaches.
title: Napa Cellars 2007 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: Quite a rich Chardonnay. Floods the mouth with sweetly ripe pineapple tart, buttered toast, vanilla crème brûlée and cinnamon flavors. Fortunately, a backbone of crisp acidity provides balance.
title: Eberle 2008 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Shows the dryness, acidic crispness and stony minerality of all Fogarty's Chards, with richer flavors of pineapples and smoky oak. Very elegant and detailed. Pair with shellfish sautéed in buttery garlic.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2006 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Here's a rich, bone-dry Chardonnay that shows long hangtime flavors of peaches, apricots, tangerines, Meyer lemons, honeysuckle, custard and tangy minerals. It's brightened with crisp acidity. Super-drinkable.
title: Molnar Family 2007 Poseidon's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros-Napa Valley)

description: This is a great price for a Chardonnay of this sophistication. It satisfies for the buttercream, buttered toast and vanilla richness to the pineapple and pear fruit, yet is balanced with crisp acidity and a minerally elegance. Drink now.
title: Rodney Strong 2007 Estate Vineyards Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Rich and oaky, with crisp acidity framing flavors of pineapple crème brûlée, yellow apricot jam, buttered toast and meringue. Flamboyant, but controlled and elegant. Drink now.
title: Ojai 2007 Solomon Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A terrific Chardonnay. You won't miss the oak at all. Offers a wealth of pineapple pie, Meyer lemon sorbet, green apple jam and vanilla flavors, brightened by clean, crisp coastal acidity. Sommeliers, buy this one in quantity. Easy to find, with 45,000 cases produced.
title: Toad Hollow 2007 Francine's Selection Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: Bright and zesty, with flavors of limes, kiwi fruit, green apples and pineapples, accompanied by crisp acidity. Could almost be an Edna Valley Chardonnay. Oak plays only a supporting role.
title: Jordan 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a big, oaky, creamy Chardonnay, but it retains the crisp acidity and overall control to be balanced and even elegant despite its size. Shows potent flavors of pineapple-infused crème brûlée, butterscotch and vanilla custard. Drink now.
title: Souverain 2007 Winemaker's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The vineyard is on the cooler western edge of Paso Robles, and this bottling has been getting better over the years. The '07 is the best yet, a dry, crisp wine of richness and polish. Shows pineapple, nectarine and guava flavors, with a subtle minerality, creamy mouthfeel, and a fine coating of smoky oak.
title: Adelaida 2007 HMR Estate Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Acidity marks this Chardonnay. It gives a tart, mouth-cleansing citrusy scour to the lemon and lime and pineapple flavors that finish so dry. It's a minimalist wine, with a minerally frame, and quite good with shellfish.
title: Fog Crest 2005 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Nice and dry, with crisp, citrusy acidity and a touch of creamy oak. Shows savory flavors of Meyer lemons, limes and tingly Asian spices, with a touch of green apple butter. Clean and food-friendly.
title: Of The Place 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fancy, with racy acidity and rich oak framing ripe natural flavors of pineapple brûlée, pear concentrate and Meyer lemon essence. Rich, but balanced and elegant.
title: Keller 2007 Oro de Plata Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is one of those Chards that's so rich, it doesn't need oak. The wine on its own is creamy rich and tartly clean, and bursts with generous flavors of limes, pineapples, kiwi fruit, vanilla bean and spice.
title: Tolosa 2007 No-Oak Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: This is a very rich Chardonnay, calculated to appeal to the preference for extremely ripe fruit enhanced with overt oak. Although it's fully dry, the wine's flavors are of decadent pineapple crème brûlée and sweet buttered toast. Lobster is the perfect partner.
title: White Oak 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Oak plays a prominent role in this Chard, giving it a wealth of sweet vanilla custard, butterscotch, toast and caramelized aromas and flavors. Under that coat is a ripe wine packed with pineapples and Meyer lemons. Drink this flamboyant wine now.
title: Stuhlmuller Vineyards 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This is a sort of second tier wine from Talbott. It's a strongly flavored Chardonnay and extremely ripe, with pineapple jam, apricot-infused crème brûlée and sweet vanilla-butterscotch flavors. But for all the richness, it's crisp and bone dry. Easy to find, with 20,000 cases.
title: Kali Hart 2007 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This is a fancy Chardonnay. It impresses for the ripe tropical fruit and citrus flavors that are generously oaked, and for the crisp coastal acidity that provides balance. The overall impression is of pineapple-infused crème brûlée. Drink now.
title: Suacci Carciere Wines 2006 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tired of oaky fruit bomb Chards? This one's notable for structure. Crisp acidity and a firm streak of minerals undergird the grilled pineapple, cinnamon apple sauce and buttered toast flavors. Drink this elegant wine now.
title: Roessler 2007 Big Bend Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Talley's Rincon Chard is vintage-driven. The 2006 shows how this year plays it strictly down the middle. It's a good wine, dry and ripe in pineapple, lemondrop and new oak flavors, wrapped into a creamy texture. Doesn't seem like an ager, so drink now.
title: Talley 2006 Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Rich and vibrant, if a little candy-sweet in ripe fruit and caramelized oak. Shows spicy flavors of pineapple custard, lemon chiffon pie and butterscotch. Drink with very rich fare, like lobster or scallops.
title: MacRostie 2006 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Bargetto's '06 reserve from their Regan Vineyards is a rich, creamy wine. It brims with classic coastal acidity and ripe flavors of grilled pineapples and roasted hazelnuts, with interesting notes of charred oak and minerals.
title: Bargetto 2006 Regan Vineyards Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a big, fat, unctuous Chardonnay marked by exceptional ripeness and smoky oak. Yet it never loses sight of balance. It's powerful in candied or pie-filling pineapple jam, Mandarin orange zest, apricot brûlée and vanilla custard flavors that are completely dry and accented with crisp acidity. This is an amazing price for a wine of this quality. Sommeliers, buy this beauty by the case.
title: Cambria 2006 Katherine's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A lush Chardonnay that shows the minerals and acidity of cool-climate Carneros. The flavors are complicated, offering waves of Meyer lemon candy, grilled pineapple, ripe Bosc pear and woodspice. Now through 2010.
title: Patz & Hall 2006 Hudson Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A lovely Chardonnay marked not only by ripeness and creamy richness, but a stony minerality that gives it a firm structure. The flavors of pineapples, pears and smoky oak are succulent. Don't chill this one too much.
title: Merryvale 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Richer and firmer than past bottlings, Frog's Leap '07 Chard is their best ever. It shows a sleek minerality undergirding ripe green apple, pear and smoky vanilla flavors. Very nice.
title: Frog's Leap 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tired of overoaked, overripe Chards? Try this streamlined beauty. It's crisp and dry, with mineral-infused Bosc pear and peach flavors, and the oak doesn't overwhelm, but provides a veneer of smoke and buttered toast.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2006 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A beautiful Chardonnay, with a chalky minerality that anchors and braces ripe fruit flavors of Bosc pears and pineapples, subtlely accented with new smoky oak. Bone dry, this polished wine shows lots of finesse and complexity.
title: La Crema 2007 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: A Chardonnay of great power, this one's from high mountains in the north county that don't have their own appellation yet, but could someday. The wine is explosive in pineapple pie, fig, tangerine marmalade and honey flavors that are almost sweet, but balanced with cool-climate acidity. Drink now through 2012.
title: Patz & Hall 2006 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Tasted in September, 2007, this Chard was a bit disjointed, showing an awkward displacement of fruit, acidity, lees and oak. But the component parts are fine, with rich pineapple brûlée, Key lime pie, butterscotch, yeast and Asian spice flavors. Give it until early 2009 to knit together, and should improve for a couple years.
title: Gainey 2006 Limited Selection Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Taft Street raised the price on their '07 Chard significantly, and it is a better wine than the '06. It's textbook cool-climate, with crisp acidity girding oak-inspired flavors of pineapples, green apples and pears.
title: Taft Street 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Much better than the winery's regular '06 Sonoma County bottling, which was released a year ago. This wine is mellowing with bottle age, showing softly decadent flavors of grilled pineapples, buttered toast and smoky oak. Easy to find, with 17,500 cases produced.
title: Simi 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Notable for sheer deliciousness, this Chardonnay hails from two of the best-known vineyards in the Carneros district. The creamy texture holds spicy flavors of pineapples, pears, vanilla, butterscotch and yeasty lees. Just 1,000 cases produced.
title: X 2007 Truchard Vineyard and Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Give this fine Chard some time in the bottle to knit together. Tasted at about one year of age, it was a little disjointed, but the parts are quite good. The flavors of pineapples, Meyer lemons and golden mango need time to integrate with the butterscotchy, caramelly oak.
title: Cakebread 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Very ripe and new oaky, but the acidity is so vibrant, it provides that much-needed balanced kick. Flavorwise, this Chard is a blast of orange Slurpee, pineapple tart, vanilla crème brûlée and cinnamon spice. It sure is an easy wine to drink.
title: Carmel Road 2006 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Oak and lees mark this Burgundy-style Chardonnay, giving a creamy, smoky, doughy full body that the underlying wine is fully capable of supporting by virtue of the strength and purity of its fruit. It's Chablisian, with mineral-infused lemon and pear flavors.
title: Dierberg 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A very nice Chardonnay with plenty of oak character that enriches the dry, ripe tropical fruit and white peach flavors. Likeable now for its clean crispness and elegance.
title: Folie à Deux 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A flashy wine. Shows sweet caramelized, buttered toast and vanilla custard notes from the oak, but the underlying fruit flavors, of golden mangoes and ripe pears, are strong enough to support the barrel influences.
title: Roche 2006 Reserve French Oak Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Delicious. Although it's packed with tropical fruit and vanilla honey flavors, the finish is thoroughly dry, and an undergirding of minerals accentuates the crispness. Only 91 cases produced.
title: Novy 2007 Keefer Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: You might not expect Chardonnay, a cool-climate wine, to thrive in the warmth of a Rutherford summer. But El Molino consistently makes a really nice one. The '06 is ripely forward in tropical fruit and pear flavors that are enriched with caramel cream and smoky vanilla. But it also has a crisp acidity that gives the wine balance and zest.
title: El Molino 2006 Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: Very rich, very flamboyant, a Chardonnay that rocks your palate with flavor, yet has the acidic structure and dryness to keep it from going over the top. Pure Bien Nacido in the wealth of tropical fruit and spice flavors, so nicely balanced with a deft touch of oak. It represents a step above the '05 and is a wine to watch.
title: La Feníªtre 2006 Bien Nacido Vineyard Block Eleven Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Drier and leaner than the 2005, this is a fancy Chardonnay marked by crisp structure and minerality, rather than extreme lushness. Yet you'll find an overlay of toasty oak and fine flavors of green apples and pineapples that satisfy the fruit tooth. The alcohol is under 14%, and the finish is totally dry.
title: Iron Horse 2006 Rued Clone Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: This is the least expensive of Rutz's current trio of Chards, but it's actually the most balanced. Shows the fancy new oak that gives vanilla and smoky caramel uplift to the pineapple and pear flavors, with crisp acidity that makes all that richness shine.
title: Rutz 2005 Maison Grand Cru Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made solidly in the ripe, oaky style, this Chard does a good job at flattering the palate with its fat, oily quality. Shows its terroir with crisp acidity and bright flavors of apricots and pineapples.
title: Pine Ridge 2006 Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The source of fine Chardonnays for several wineries, the Porter-Bass vineyard is close to the Pacific. In the cool year of 2006, De Loach's bottling is high in acids, very dry and minerally, with suggestions of nectarines, lemons, peaches, green apples and papayas. A little hard now, it could soften and improve sometime in 2009.
title: De Loach 2006 Porter-Bass Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Similar in flavor and structure to the regular '06 Chard, Schug's reserve is oakier and has more punch. The pear, peach, golden mango, honey and mineral flavors are firmed and toned by crisp Carneros acidity.
title: Schug 2006 Heritage Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a complex young Chardonnay, irresolute right now, that needs some time in the bottle. It's all gawky elbows and knees now, with acidity over here, new oak over there, lees floating around, and ripe flavors of limes, peaches and pineapples. All these parts are very good. Try in 2009.
title: Laetitia 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: A very elaborate Chardonnay showing flavors of exotic fruits, spices, buttered toast and cream. Charred oak and acidity currently dominate, making the wine a little rigid, but a year or two in bottle should soften and sweeten.
title: Bjornstad 2006 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Oak currently stars in this tight, immature Chardonnay. Its parts haven't melded together. The smoky, caramelized wood is over here, the pears, green apples and mangoes are over there, and the acidity is free-floating all around. Needs time. Wait until mid-2009.
title: Bjornstad 2006 Porter Bass Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Rich and powerful, this well-oaked Chardonnay needs a little time to come around. As it stands, it's a tense, dry, nervous wine, tight in acids and steely minerals, rather like a young Chablis. Give it a few years for the pear and tropical fruit flavors to sweeten and emerge.
title: Bjornstad 2006 Barbed Oak Vineyard Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

description: Bouchaine has a long history of making balanced, delicate Chards, the kind that don't stand out in competitions, but marry well with food. Their '06 is dry and crisp, with mineral and slate flavors undergirding citrus, pear and smoky oak tastes.
title: Bouchaine 2006 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Very rich and honeyed, a powerhouse Chard oozing with pineapple jam, crème brûlée, and coconut candy flavors. For all its sweet mouthfeel, the wine is dry and crisp in brilliant acidity.
title: Navarro 2006 Premier Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Showing Talley's distinctive elegance and brilliant structure, this Chard is a blend of the Rincon and Rosemary's vineyards. The wine's architecture really makes it special, with acidity and dusty tannins providing the bare bones to the lemon, lime, pineapple and mango fruit. A great wine to have with food.
title: Talley 2006 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Creamy smooth and enlivened with brisk acidity, this Chard shows forward, tart green apple, lime and pineapple flavors. Oak barrels add even richer notes of buttered toast and butterscotch to this elegant sipper.
title: Sequoia Grove 2006 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This bottling has been remarkably consistent over the last several vintages. Always exotic in lemondrop-candy fruit that's been well-oaked, it has nuances of flower petals, white peaches, minerals and honey. The '06 may be a little softer than past vintages.
title: Williams Selyem 2006 Hawk Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Reminiscent of the 2000, this wine has a crisp, linear character that emphasizes minerals rather than the overt tropical fruits the vineyard shows in warmer vintages. It's a fine, dry, acidic Chardonnay whose oak-infused lemon and lime flavors will complement sourdough bread and cracked crab.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2006 Belle Terre Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Racy and pure, this Chard shows the bright lime, lemon and kiwi flavors of Edna Valley Chards, with a sleek undergirding of steely minerals. It's crisp and dry, although smoky oak lends caramel and vanilla notes.
title: Domaine Alfred 2006 Chamisal Vineyards Califa Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Almost like a young Sauvignon Blanc, it's so acidic and juicy in citrus, lime peel, green apple, tangerine, fig and jasmine tea flavors. The wine was fermented entirely in stainless steel and did not undergo malolactic fermentation. Very enjoyable, and something different in Chardonnay.
title: Standish 2006 Day Ranch Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Lots of richness in this dry, minerally Chardonnay. It has forward flavors of peaches, pears, baked green apples and flint, while lots of new oak contributes honey and caramel notes.
title: Robert Stemmler 2005 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: You can almost smell the minerals and acids in this Chardonnay. The flavors verify the aroma, adding fruitier notes of limes, sweet apples and white peaches, complexed with the creamy, smoky nuances of new oak and sur lies aging.
title: Longoria 2006 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The vineyard is owned by the Farrells, and is located in the Green Valley, the coolest section of Russian River. The wine is very bright in acidity and clean and clear in minerals, with notes of tart lemondrop, brioche and Asian pear. Lees add a distinct taste of yeast and a rich, creamy texture. Perfect with cracked crab.
title: Gary Farrell 2005 Cresta Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is Marimar's extended lees contact Chard, and it's characterized by a creamy, slightly yeasty taste. That's on top of the fruit, which is classic Green Valley tart green apples, citrus fruits and pears. The acidity is crisp and balancing, giving the wine good structure.
title: Marimar Estate 2005 Dobles Lías Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a floral, minerally wine, with wildflower, orange spice and honey aromas almost like a Viognier. In the mouth, it erupts in fruit so sweet, it's almost like a dessert wine, with pineapple custard and lemon cream flavors. A little off-beat for a Chard, but very good.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2006 Highland Estates Seco Highlands Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: An interesting Chardonnay from the hills above this exclusive enclave, the wine never went through malolactic fermentation. That's a good thing, as it lends a minerally crispness to the very ripe peach, pear, apricot, lemon, lime and pineapple flavors. New oak adds just the right touch of smoky, woody char.
title: Rosenthal-Malibu Estate 2006 Chardonnay (Malibu-Newton Canyon)

description: The '06 shows a return to ripeness. It's lush in pineapple and mango fruit, and the rich overlay of oak adds complexing notes of smoke, vanilla and wood spice.
title: White Oak 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Only two cases of this wine were produced. It is quite good-a little deficient in acidity, but richly textured and creamy. Offers up an array of toasted apple, pear, pineapple and caramelized oak flavors, finishing in a burst of dusty spices.
title: Signorello 2006 Hope's Cuvée Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: If you like your Chards Burgundian style, you love the creamy complexity of this one. Only slightly oaked, it bursts with pineapple custard, green apple butter, guava, crème brûlée, vanilla, toast and cinnamon flavors, with a very long, honey-spicy finish.
title: Kenwood 2006 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a bright, crisp young Chard. It's bone dry and vibrant in Meyer lemon, tropical fruit, spice and vanilla smoke flavors, with a keen, tangy streak of minerality. Tremendously versatile as a food wine due to its balance and finesse.
title: Ojai 2006 Solomon Hills Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Gallo has held this Chard more than 4 years before release; the reason may be an acidic tightness that still dominates the wine. It's deep in mineral-infused apricot and quince fruit. The barrel regimen consisted of 100% new oak. It's a big, absolutely dry, almost rasping wine, and may be one of those rare California Chards capable of aging. See what it does after 2008.
title: Gallo Family Vineyards 2003 Chardonnay (Northern Sonoma)

description: Fogarty's basic '05 Chard shows an exciting crispness and minerality that, good as it is, makes you long for the single-vineyard bottlings to come. There's an elegant angularity to the wine despite the succulent pineapples, kiwis and new oak, and a brisk acidity that makes it finish vibrantly clean.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2005 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is rich, ripe, fat and seemingly oaky. It may be too much of a good thing. Massive in caramelized, butterscotch, pineapple, peach, apricot, lime and cotton candy flavors, it might overpower any food you have it with. Almost better as a cocktail sipper.
title: Pellegrini 2005 Olivet Lane Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There's something Chablisian about this Chardonnay. It's partly the acidity, which is high, and partly the gunmetal minerality, courtesy of another cool vintage in the southern Napa/Carneros region where the grapes were grown. Add in oak-infused pineapples, peaches and pears, and you have a fairly significant wine that could even benefit from some years in the cellar.
title: Stags' Leap Winery 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Ripeness was not a problem with this wine, which is fat and unctuous. It shows complex apricot, mineral, pear, green apple and lees flavors that finish with a glyceriney taste of honey. Should develop for a few years in the bottle.
title: Williams Selyem 2005 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Smooth, crisply acidic and bone dry, this Chard shows an austere minerality and streamlined texture that makes it very food-friendly. It's packed with Meyer lemon, yellow apricot and fig flavors that finish long and spicy. Really nice, and shows the promise of Lake County for Chardonnay.
title: Shannon Ridge 2006 Chardonnay (Lake County)

description: Shows the softness of Alexander Valley Chardonnay, and the delicious complexity that these wines can attain. Apricots, pineapples, peaches and Meyer lemons are the fruits, framed by vanilla and smoke from new oak, and finishing with a minerality that must come from the earth.
title: Summers 2006 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Just beautiful and oh, so refreshing. The cool vintage has resulted in a high-acid wine of enormous fruit, bursting with intense, classic Edna Valley flavors of limes, kiwis, Meyer lemons, honeysuckle and minerals. The vanilla spice and creamy smoke have got to come from the terroir, because the wine never saw a splinter of oak.
title: Tolosa 2006 Edna Ranch No-Oak Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: They pulled out all the stops on this white Burgundy-inspired Chard. It tastes quite leesy, with a Champagne-like yeastiness riding over the tropical fruit and oaky, caramelized flavors. Complex and intriguing, this unfined, unfiltered Chard should drink well for the next few years.
title: Chalk Hill 2005 Unfined & Unfiltered Estate Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: This is a polished, really likeable Chard. It offers everything the variety should: a rich, creamy texture, brisk acidity, and ripe, delicious flavors of pineapples, apricots, peaches and kiwis coated with vanilla.
title: La Crema 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Here's a polished Chard with an elegant balance to a variety that often lacks both. Everything is here, from the ripe tropical fruit and rich oak to the crisp acidity and mineral trimmings, all poised in perfect equilibrium.
title: Arrowood 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: The grapes are from all parts of the valley, cool as well as warm, and the wine shows a complex structure and rich fruity flavors. The tiers of pineapples, tangerines, sautéed bananas, green apples and butterscotch have a honeyed, botrytisy richness, although the finish is thoroughly dry.
title: Freemark Abbey 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Notable for very high acidity, this Chard would be aggressive were it not for the ripe, honeyed flavors and creamy texture, which soften it up. The flavors are very pure and clean: of kiwi, lime, mango and papaya.
title: Baileyana 2005 Grand Firepeak Cuvée Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Minerals, acidity and sweet green argula give a tangy tinge to the underlying citrus fruit in this dry, structured wine. Fans of big, fat Chards will find it austere, but those valuing elegance will call it Chablisian.
title: Calera 2004 Chardonnay (Mt. Harlan)

description: Dry and crisp, this Chard, which was 100% barrel fermented, has complex flavors of flowers, minerals and citrus fruits, with a rich vein of toasty oak. It's quite elegant and a great food wine. Easy to find, with 19,000 cases produced.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A very interesting wine that clearly shows its cool-climate origins, with a great big burst of brisk acidity that gets the tastebuds whistling. Underneath are pure flavors of green apples and ripe kiwis. The oak is sizable, but perfect for this formula, adding delicious honey, butterscotch and vanilla flavors. This is the best J. Lynne Chard I've had.
title: J. Lynne 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This immature Chard needs some time in the bottle for the rich acids and forward oak to knit together with the tremendous wealth of tropical fruit. Give it until 2008, by which time it should provide opulent pleasure.
title: Pine Ridge 2005 Epitome Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A full-bodied, richly textured Chardonnay, with toasty, nutty notes accenting melon and pear flavors. Despite about 70% malolactic fermentation, this avoids buttery excess, instead coming across as toasted hazelnuts and whole grain.
title: Sonoma Coast Vineyards 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Shows the bright acidity of Carneros, which seems even brighter this cool vintage. That accentuates the lush flavors of puréed pineapples, guavas, nectarines, butterscotch and honey, leading to a long, spicy, rewarding finish. Easy to find, with more than 16,000 cases produced.
title: Buena Vista 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Ironstone's Reserve Chard has been getting interesting of late, and the '05 is a fascinating study in vintage, contrasted with the '04. The vintage was a cool one, and the wine is loaded with acidity and minerality reminscent of Chablis. You can taste things like granite and mica that give a rich tang of earth to the underlying pineapple and oak flavors. Finishes long and totally dry.
title: Ironstone 2005 Reserve Chardonnay (Calaveras County)

description: Shows the tangy minerality this cool appellation is known for. The pear, green apple, lime and kiwi fruit has a cold metal, almost chalky edge that lends this wine a Chablisian complexity. Bone dry and elegant, it should develop over the next five years.
title: Iron Horse 2005 Estate Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Dry, oaky and tart in citrus and tropical fruits, this Chard teeters on the edge of everyday drinkability and white tablecloth sophistication. The layers of buttercream, crème brûlée and vanilla custard tilt the balance toward elegance.
title: Laetitia 2005 Estate Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: A crisp, fresh, medium-bodied Chardonnay, this is toasty and nutty but not overly vanilla-scented. Grilled peach and buttered sweet corn notes pick up citrus overtones that finish long and mouthwatering.
title: J. Lohr 2005 Arroyo Vista Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Nice and oaky and rich, from a vineyard in the heart of the cool-climate southern part of Russian River Valley. Acidity stars, giving zesty balance to the ripe pineapple, green apple, Key lime pie and pear flavors. New oak, to the tune of 40%, adds an opulent touch.
title: Pellegrini 2005 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Oaky and ripe, with powerful tropical pineapple, kumquat, mineral and floral aromas and flavors. New oak adds smoke, vanilla and char. The bottom line is of a flavorful, acidic and elegant Chard with a lingering, spicy finish.
title: Marimar Estate 2004 Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Rich and appealing, a new bottling from the winery. All the parts have yet to knit together, but they're all good, and the wine should drink well by winter 2007. New oak frames tart green apple, pineapple, kumquat and cinnamon spice flavors that are heightened by bright, zesty acidity.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2005 Emelia's Cuvée Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: They didn't let any malolactic fermentation into this wine, a wise decision because you wouldn't want it to be any softer. Still, there's a prettiness to the ripe green apple, honey and toast flavors, which are complexed with layers of tropical fruits, spices and lees.
title: El Molino 2005 Chardonnay (Rutherford)

description: What's so nice about this wine is that it has full-throttle Chard personality while keeping everything so balanced that it's also a versatile food wine. You can't say that about a lot of Chardonnays. Mainly it's the acidity, but also the complex, subtle interplay of fruit and oak. A very nice job.
title: Robert Mondavi 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Here's a polished, delicate wine that shows the poise and elegance that Carneros Chard can achieve. It's varietally pure, with pineapple, mineral and toast flavors that finish dry, a wine meant to enjoy with food, rather than star on its own. Easy to find, with 31,000 cases produced.
title: Cuvaison 2005 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Nice, dry and complex, a crisp wine with quite a bit of minerality undergirding the fruit and oak. Feels fine and balanced in the mouth, and should take a couple years in the cellar.
title: Bouchaine 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Here's a dry Chardonnay, notable for its firm structure. Acidity and oak tannins provide the framework for the candied Meyer lemon, mango, floral, mineral and buttered toast flavors. There's a touch of bitterness in the finish that suggests very modest aging. Drink now through 2008.
title: Byington 2004 Quenneville Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: The grapes got real ripe, to judge by the bright burst of yellow apricots and exotic passionfruits. At the same time, acidity is crisp and citrusy, and there's a pleasant yeasty character, like Champagne, or a nice fino Sherry. The wine finishes totally dry, leaving a palate impression of great elegance. Drink now through 2010.
title: Tandem 2004 Porter-Bass Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is certainly a better Chard than the winery's '04. It's richer and more succulent, overall more rewarding in varietal fruit, including peaches and cream, pineapples, guavas and papayas, with a cinnamon spice finish. The wine also is characterized by crisp, crunchy acidity that makes it racy.
title: Sequoia Grove 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: As is usually the case, Bernardus's regular Monterey Chard offers lots of bang for the buck. Dry and crisp in citrusy acids, it has complex flavors of pineapple, grapefruit, kiwi, lime and spicy coconut macaroon, with delicious oak influence.
title: Bernardus 2005 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Easily the richest of Schug's current trio of Chards, showing the elegance and crispness of the other bottlings, but with more fruity intensity. It's still a fairly restrained wine, rich in acidity and dry minerality, but rewards with pineapple custard and butterscotch flavors.
title: Schug 2005 Heritage Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a wine that does best in cool vintages, which '05 was. A blend of Carneros and Bennett Valley, the wine shows Burgundian character, with apple butter, pineapple custard and lemon zest flavors undergirded by a rich, stony minerality, and a long, rewarding, spicy finish. Very nice now, and should develop for five years.
title: Matanzas Creek 2005 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Bill Brosseau is Testarossa's winemaker and now he has his own brand, from his vineyard up in the Gavilan mountains. It's a very good Chard, a little tight in minerals and acidity, but oak adds richness to the tropical fruit and apricot flavors. It's delicious and a pretty good value.
title: Brosseau 2005 Brosseau Vineyard Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: Wow, what a good value. This is a Chard that shows tremendous authority and power, not to mention that cool-climate character of Santa Rita Hills. Bursts with bright Meyer lemondrop, Key-lime pie, vanilla custard and smoky oak aromas, with similar flavors that are heightened by crisp, clean acidity.
title: Gainey 2005 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is one tough wine. It's all acidity, steel and minerals, and extreme dryness. with lots of new oak. The fruit veers toward toasted lemon zest. Winemaker Anthony Austin says he made this wine to age, which seems a safe bet. Best 2008-2010.
title: Sonoma Coast Vineyards 2003 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: The  wine is intense, with firm acids and a chalkiness to the peach, guava and nectarine flavors. This is an elegant wine that will last and improve over six years.
title: De Tierra 2005 Coast View Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey)
