description: Ojai is making Chardonnays in a drier, leaner and lower alcohol style than many others, but the wines reward for their extreme elegance and Chablisian minerality. This one, from a cool vineyard within sight of the Pacific, is streamlined, with flavors of citrus rind, tapioca and oak, and is very high in mouthwatering acidity.
title: Ojai 2008 Solomon Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Tastes honey sweet in butterscotch, buttered toast and caramel. The sweetness dominates well ripened pineapple and tangerine flavors. But the fruity power is there. It needs a year or so in the bottle to emerge, and even a brief decant will bring greater harmony to this expressively opulent wine.
title: Lynmar 2008 La Sereinité Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A really nice, elegant Chardonnay at a good price. The wine is dry and lightly oaked, showing rich pineapple, peach, vanilla and buttered toast flavors enhanced with crisp acidity. Only 731 cases were produced of this lovely, food-friendly wine.
title: Talley 2008 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Ultra-rich and decadent, Morgan's 08 Double L shows its signature tropical fruit, apricot and mineral flavors, accented with the smoky vanilla, buttered toast and caramel from toasted oak, and brightened with acidity. Although it's dry, it's oozing in glycerine and honey. Will not age, so drink up.
title: Morgan 2008 Double L Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Shows a deft hand at balancing all the elements. Ripe, citrusy tropical fruits and green apples, oak, minerals, racy acidity, lees and the byproducts of malolactic fermentation all come together to produce a rich, complex, fruity young Chardonnay. Gets better as it warms in the glass.
title: Clos La Chance 2008 Biagini Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a firm, dry, minerally Chardonnay. It's not blockbuster rich, but it is clean and vibrant and elegant. The flinty flavors are enriched with notes of pineapples and green apples, while oak and lees give hints of buttered toast and sour cream. A very fine, food-friendly wine that sommeliers should be aware of.
title: Windsor Sonoma 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of crisp, citrusy acidity in this wine, which brightens the pineapple, orange, lemon and lime flavors. Meanwhile, 100% new oak adds a rich coating of smoky, buttered toast. The wine is dramatic, rather than subtle, and is at its best now.
title: Iron Horse 2008 Rued Clone Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Very dry, crisp and minerally, with subtle citrus fruit and floral flavors, this Chardonnay suggests Chablis as its model. The elegant structure is likeable. If you're a fan of big fruit, it's not for you, but it's quite a classy Chardonnay. Good with cracked crab with drawn butter and buttered sourdough bread.
title: Roessler 2008 Big Bend Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Released unusually at the age of nearly five years, this Chardonnay is losing its primary fruit. It's developing a toasted cashew and hazelnut character, and the pineapples are transmogrifying to chewy dried fruits and even Christmas fruitcake. Meanwhile the sweet, caramelized oak is fully integrated. Bravo to the winery for holding this back and letting us see what an older Sonoma Coast Chardonay does.
title: Fort Ross Winery 2005 Fort Ross Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A very interesting Chardonnay, and easily worth the price. It was fermented in 50% new French oak, which gives it a creamy, smoky richness, while the underlying fruit flavors are ripe and rewarding, suggesting pineapples, Asian pears, green apples and Meyer lemons. A beautiful, complex and balanced wine.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2008 Director's Cut Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: One hundred percent new French oak is the dominant theme here. It floods the mouth with the flavors of buttered toast and vanilla. The oak influence is strong, but the underlying wine has some equally strong pineapple, mango and apple fruit. It's made in a rich California style you either love or hate.
title: Parallel 2008 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in the modern, ripe style, but with a greater degree of finesse than you might expect at this price. The wine is dry and crisp and minerally, with a clean mouthfeel, yet offers rich flavors of pineapples, green apples and peaches. Easy to find, with more than 12,000 cases produced.
title: Benziger 2008 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Smells bright, citrusy and clean, an impression followed in the mouth, where intricate flavors of pineapple, lemondrop candy and Key lime pie turn spicy on the finish. The acidity is brisk; the wine did not go through malolactic fermentation. Just shows that a great Chardonnay doesn't need oak, although sur lies aging gives it a notable creaminess.
title: Cambria 2007 Unwooded Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A beautiful Chardonnay that shows ripe, long hangtime fruit flavors of pineapples, apricots, peaches and papayas, offset with clean acidity. Shows a touch of oak. Will satisfy Chard fans, and is super food-friendly with grilled salmon, shrimp, scallops.
title: J. Lohr 2007 October Night Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: A very good Chardonnay that displays admirable dryness and firmness of structure, with good fruit. Feels clean in the mouth, with a taste of cold steel that undergirds pineapple and buttered toast flavors.
title: Hahn Estates 2007 SLH Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A new price point tier for K-J, in between Grand Reserve and Highlands Estates. Bright and racy in cool-climate acidity, with layered flavors of lemondrop candy, lemon chiffon pie and buttered toast. Delicious and savory. The grapes are from the Santa Maria Valley and the Los Alamos region.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2008 Jackson Hills Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is Cohn's reserve-style Chardonnay and it's easily their best since the 1990s. Made from two vineyards in the cool Carneros district of Sonoma, it's ripe in pineapple and green apple flavors enhanced with the toast of oak, the creaminess of lees and the buttery softness of malolactic fermentation. Easy to drink with opulent fare such as crab.
title: B.R. Cohn 2008 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: New toasty oak currently dominates, offering the butterscotch, buttered toast and caramel flavors that so many people think is the taste of Chardonnay, but is not. The true fruit stands out as pineapples and pears. It's a very clean, hedonistic wine to drink now with rich fare, like shellfish.
title: Tandem 2007 Lorenzo Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The winery doesn't tell us where in this gigantic, multi-county region the grapes came from, but it's quite a good wine. Firm in citrusy acids, with a mineral undertow, it's a dry, elegant wine with complex notes of pineapples, buttered toast and creamy lees. Lots of oak, but it's integrated with the fruit.
title: Hestan 2007 Chardonnay (San Francisco Bay)

description: With high alcohol and 100% new French oak, this wine could easily be clumsy, but it isn't. It defines the ripe California style. It's a little hot, but so massive in flavors of pineapples, lemondrop candy, crème brûlée and sweet buttered toast, you can't help but be impressed. A winery and wine to watch.
title: Knights Bridge 2007 West Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)

description: A rich but elegant Chardonnay. Shows massive, concentrated flavors of pineapples, pears and green apples, liberally accented with the vanilla and buttered toast of oak barrels. Flamboyant, yet balanced with crisp coastal acidity and a tang of minerals.
title: Patz & Hall 2007 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A beautifully streamlined Chardonnay, showing the minerality and austerity that often accompanies young Chards from this mountain appellation. It has dry flavors of pineapples, peaches and smoky oak. Needs time. Should come into its own after 2010.
title: Roessler 2007 Brosseau Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: You want soft, gooey Chardonnay? Go someplace else. This is a steely, minerally, bracing wine whose high acidity makes your mouth water. It has a little oak, but is mainly noted for the intensity of pineapple, peach and vanilla flavors. Very nice with shellfish and pasta in a cream sauce.
title: Foxen 2008 Bien Nacido Vineyard Steel Cut Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Brings Foxen's usual steely, dry, minerally approach to Chardonnay, which makes for a more versatile, elegant wine. It's bone dry, while high acidity makes the mouth water, but the austerity is relieved by the ripeness of the citrus, peach and apple fruit. Should develop through 2013, becoming creamier and nuttier.
title: Foxen 2008 Bien Nacido Vineyard Block UU Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Shows lots of sweet, smoky oak and superripe flavors of pineapple tart, lemon meringue pie and zesty limes. For all that richness, the wine is balanced with crisp acidity and a streak of stony minerals. Fine now and through 2011.
title: Mi Sueño 2007 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Here's a polished, rich Chardonnay that bests many more expensive wines. It's creamy and lush, but crisp in acids, with deep flavors of pineapples, pears, buttered toast, vanilla and honey. A great job from a winery that consistently over-delivers.
title: Martin Ray 2008 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a very flamboyant Chardonnay. The grapes are superripe in pie-filling pineapples, nectarines and oranges, enhanced with smoky oak and sweet buttered popcorn, but the finish is completely dry. Drink now with rich fare, like lobster and shellfish.
title: Gann 2007 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is the richest Frostwatch Chardonnay ever. It just explodes in the mouth, with waves of ripe pineapple, peach, pear, lemon custard and spice flavors. The oak influence offers richer elements of crème brûlée. Drink now for sheer opulence.
title: Frostwatch 2007 Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)

description: The vintage was great, the vineyard is in a great part of the valley, and the wine is wonderful. It's ultrarich in tropical fruit, buttered toast, buttercream and spice flavors, but perfectly balanced with acidity and minerals.
title: Pellegrini 2007 Olivet Lane Vineyard Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a light, delicate white, with aromas of honeysuckle and Meyer lemon zest. High in acidity, it invites green apple and pear flavors on the palate, bolstered by seasonings of lemongrass and ginger. It'll please a crowd or excel at starting off a meal.
title: Jax 2016 Y3 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Baked apple, lime pith, butter-poached pear and almonds show on the nose of this ripe bottling. There is a tightly wound texture to the palate, carrying flavors of apple and nectarine, with a citrus-driven grapefruit pith finish.
title: J. Lohr 2016 October Night Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: From Mill Station and Shop Block-two exceptional properties farmed by the Duttons-this wine opens awash in anise and wildflowers, with bright, steely acidity. Lemon, orange and green apple flavors define the palate, tempered by an underlying lushness of fruit.
title: Anaba 2015 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Jasmine and orange blossom aromas start off this wine. The palate brings spicy oak and melon flavors cut through by steely, bright acidity. Creaminess ultimately wins out on the finish.
title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2016 Southworth Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: A combination of spicy, fruity and savory flavors, as well as a suave texture, make this wine quite impressive. Subtle nutmeg and vanilla aromas lead to fresh pear and white peach flavors, with a touch of minerality for a tasty but not extreme personality.
title: Scotto Family Cellars 2016 Anthony & Dominic Chardonnay (North Coast)

description: Medium bodied and well-crafted, from a tremendously well-farmed site, this white is crisp and acid-driven with a lightness of being that surprises. Asian pear and crème brûlée both play a part in intriguing the palate.
title: Ram's Gate 2015 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A muted nose of toasted oak and brioche leads to an expansive and fleshy midpalate of apple and peach in this moderately structured, medium-bodied and balanced wine. The finish is lingering and vibrantly bright in acidity.
title: MacRostie 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: There is a honeydew rind tightness and a lemon curd opulence to the nose of this bottling from a vineyard planted in 1997, along with chalk and lemongrass aromas. The palate starts with strong grip and then opens with tart lime skin and a hint of butter-very refreshing.
title: Joyce 2016 Tondre Grapefield Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Sea salt, preserved lemons, pan-seared apples, plumeria and honeysuckle show on the engaging nose of this bottling from a preferred block in this historic vineyard. The palate plays to the savory side of Chardonnay, offering an oily texture that carries flavors of cashew and marmalade.
title: Foxen 2016 Block UU Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Clean lines of Meyer lemon, hazelnut and vanilla are framed by a smoky oak touch on this first ever Chardonnay from this winery. The wood flavors show prominently on the sip, which offers toast with lime preserves and a hint of forest spice.
title: Challen 2015 Zotovich Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine, from a tiny mountainside vineyard, has an especially deep gold color, bold aromas of orange zest and peaches, and rich but bright fruit flavors shaded by mineral and spice notes. It feels full in body and viscous in texture, giving a lot of palate impact.
title: Drew 2015 Valenti Ranch Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)

description: This stainless steel expression starts with a plump, fresh and fruity nose of rounded melon, lemon bars, candied marshmallow and butterscotch. The opulence tightens up severely on the palate, where a zesty acidity and pithy grip carry flaors of baked apples, lemon rinds and sea salt.
title: Boekenoogen 2016 Stainless Steel Fermented Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Salty caramel and oak are well integrated and in balance in this vineyard-designated white from a well-farmed cool coastal site. Crisp textures of apple and lemon shine alongside the medium-bodied frame of ripeness.
title: Vermeil 2015 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Velvety smooth in sublime flavors of green apple and toasted oak, this wine takes a light approach to ripeness, allowing for the tart pineapple fruit to speak quietly around an acid-driven core.
title: Red Car 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is creamy and lush in vanilla, marshmallow and a healthy helping of toasted oak, yet it evolves in the glass to show undeniable acidity and mineral-laden aspects of dried herb and crushed rock. The finish emphasizes its light-bodied approach.
title: MacRostie 2015 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: With a voluptuous nose of caramel, this wine is fleshy yet offers integrated acidity and oak. Layers of lemon meringue and ginger snap flavors carry the palate, offering richness and ripeness in a balanced context.
title: Chalk Hill 2015 Wright Creek Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)

description: Creamy and bright, this is a nicely made white, attractively priced. Medium bodied, it's lengthy in integrated oak with fresh focused flavors of quince, orange and white peach.
title: Friedeman 2016 Dichotomy Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fermented in stainless steel and then aged for 15 months in French oak, only 30% of it new, this wine shows a nice grasp of restraint and acidity, offering honey, rock and toast against a backdrop of Meyer lemon and waxy apple. Bright, persistent acidity rules the day, cradled in just the right amount of structured oak.
title: Côte West 2015 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This value-driven white is robust and exuberant, with an exotic tropical nose. Serious oak wraps around fleshy, lengthy amounts of mango, pineapple and lemongrass, with a linger of Tahitian vanilla on the finish.
title: Publix 2016 Premium Limited Edition Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This twist-top bottling plays up the region's riper styles yet in a tightly chiseled fashion, starting with aromas of lychee, Asian pear soufflé, brioche and the lightest touch of marshmallow. Salt, cream and exotic white-fleshed fruits show on the palate, which finishes with a touch of butterscotch.
title: Rock Wall 2015 Vigna Monte Nero Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This tightly wound, still very young bottling from Rick Longoria's estate vineyard needs a little time to open up, but when it does, there are grapefruit pith, candied lemon rind and freeze-dried honeydew aromas to enjoy. The texture is tremendously chalky, delivering flavors of lime skin, apple rind and orange candies.
title: Longoria 2015 Fe Ciega Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Crisp and light aromas of squeezed lemon, Pink Lady apple and Rainier cherry prove soft and supple on the nose. The palate is almost effervescent in acidity and crispness, showing lime peel flavors and a chalky backbone.
title: Whitcraft 2016 Zotovich Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Drenched with melted butter and vanilla flavors, but not blatantly oaky, this full-bodied Chardonnay is so lush that it's almost sweet. It seems to expand on the palate, brimming with delicious Fuji apple and Bosc pear notes that don't quit but last through a lingering finish.
title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Reserve Collection Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Shades of subtle oak, fig and lemongrass are framed by tightly wound acidity on the palate. Light in feel, this is a bright, exotic Chardonnay with loads of energy.
title: Hendry 2015 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Elliott Dolin's wines continue to make the strongest case for the potential of Malibu viticulture. This bottling shows rounded aromas of lemon rind, white peach, tangerine and a touch of butter. There is great energy and grip on the sip, where nectarine flavors meet with sea salt and sandalwood.
title: Dolin 2015 Chardonnay (Malibu-Newton Canyon)

description: From a great site, this tiny production wine is dark gold in color and oaky on the nose. Baked caramel apple, lemon chiffon and nutmeg all play a role-bold flavors that highlight this well-made effort that offers a throughput of bright acidity.
title: La Pitchoune 2014 Chenoweth Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This blend of grapes from Rita's Crown and Radian vineyards delivers a unique nose of wet wood, lemon verbena, macadamia nut and nectarine cream. The mouthfeel is zippy and the backbone is quite chalky, carrying flavors of poached Asian pear, sea salt and lemon zest, with touches of pecan and browned butter.
title: Velvet Bee 2013 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Very chalky aromas of lime skins, lemon rinds and a touch of Gala apple flesh makes for an inviting nose to this estate bottling. The palate picks up the region's telltale sea salt flavors, which give savory depth to the seared lemon rind flavors. The acidity and texture are both firm.
title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Sophisticated and full bodied, this generous style of wine wraps complex and subtle oak spices around a warm, generous core of ripe pear and apple notes. Wonderful vanilla bean and nutmeg nuances linger in the creamy texture and echo on the finish.
title: Tangley Oaks 2015 Lot 12 Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Bright, focused acidity flirts with the medium-bodied palate that boasts flavors of lemon and grapefruit. A background of supportive oak never gets in the way, offering complementing tones of nutmeg and vanilla.
title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2015 Southworth Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: There's a strong hazelnut character on this bottling from an iconic vineyard, with touches of lemon-laced crème brûlée and pink grapefruit zest. The nutty quality translates to pecans on the sip, with orange marmalade, toasted croissant and a slight bit of marshmallow toward the finish.
title: Dolin 2014 Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: From a historic vineyard, this Chardonnay is quite Burgundian in style, showing much potential for this grape in Paso Robles. Reserved aromas of lemon rind, vanilla shavings and cashew are quite fresh, while the palate drives the middle road, with tight grapefruit rind and mandarin pith flavors on one side and plumeria and guava on the other. Chalky texture throughout.
title: Adelaida 2016 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)

description: This appellation blend allows a more affordable taste of the Talley family's Chardonnay excellence. This bottling shows aromas of Meyer lemon skins, warm nectarine, sea salt, tangerine pith and wet sidewalk. Rounded salt and stone fruit flavors show on the sip, but the citrusy acidity is persistent, cutting through the slight butter warmth. Caramel pops on the finish.
title: Talley 2015 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Creamy and luxurious in nature, this wine tastes of caramel apple, baked pear and pineapple. With a depth of vanilla oak, it offers body and weight, with a bright hit of freshness on the lengthy finish.
title: Roberts & Rogers 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Wet clay, squeezed lemon and lightly toasted pecan show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard located just south of Highway 246. There's ripeness to the lemon-juice-driven palate as well as a rounded cashew cream character. The acidity is striking, nearly piercing by the finish.
title: Pali 2015 Huber Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There is plenty of toasty oak on the nose of this reserve bottling, but it's judiciously applied and cut by lemon balm, Asian pear, hot croissant and pecan oil aromas. The sip also shows a savory oak-smoke character, but the midpalate is all about lemon cream and butter-basted apple pie, with a touches of vanilla, cinnamon and cashew riding into the finish.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Extremely pleasant aromas of caramel-laced honeydew cream and light cashew show on the nose of this bottling that's focused on a specific block of this historic vineyard. The palate zings with freshness and acidity right out of the gates, and then allows fatter notes of melted butter, orange peels, mandarin slices and clotted cream to consume the midpalate.
title: Cambria 2015 Fog Tide Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Broad aromas of melon, warm nectarine, light lime and melted butter make for a creamy nose on this single-vineyard expression. There is a compelling tightness to the sip, where the acidic zing cuts through richer flavors of campfire-roasted lemon and prominent oak smoke.
title: Black Kite 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A hearty, generously full-bodied and concentrated wine, this has an intensity of oak that works against the ripe fruit. Gravenstein apple speaks loudest, accented in wild fennel, salty air and nutmeg.
title: B Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: There is an intensity of oak that greets the nose of this wine, leading to baked-fruit flavors of apple and pineapple, with and nutmeg offering nuance. Bright, persistent acidity cuts through the rich palate and complements its creaminess.
title: Trombetta 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine is made with grapes from the Sangiacomo Vineyard and barrel fermented to produce a richly layered expression of peach, pear and stony minerality. With a grit of texture, it's a fulsome, lush and voluptuous wine with a salty tease.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2015 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The intriguing nose on this bottling combines a bit of melted butterscotch and ripe white peach with a lime-spray freshness. There's a strong flash of acidity at the tip of the sip, and then come more oaky flavors, showing toasted marshmallow, browned butter and a hint of caramel.
title: Tantara 2015 Talley Rincon Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Extremely clean on the nose, pure aromas of lemon mousse, coconut milk and white peach are cut by a chalky minerality and fresh lemongrass scent in this bottling. There's a pencil shaving touch to the sip, which is a tad riper than expected, with mouth-watering lemon cake and cream flavors.
title: Tantara 2015 Dierberg Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A lush concentration of pineapple, pear and vanilla takes root in this richly layered and complex wine. With a voluptuous midpalate, it has a lingering thread of acidity on the finish that's like a succulent bite of tangerine.
title: Westwood 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Roberts Road Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Unadorned by oak, this focused white is a mix of sweet peach and succulent citrus. Its backbone of juicy fruit is layered and deliciously crisp.
title: Pellegrini 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a concentrated and deliciously lush white wine, highlighted in thick notions of honey, pear and swirls of caramel. Expressive and ripe, it does justice to the warm-vintage and focused winemaking.
title: Duckhorn 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This full-bodied wine does a superb job of blending luscious fruit flavors of Anjou pear and fresh fig with a spice rack of nutmeg, vanilla and cinnamon. Good concentration and depth help it feel full and creamy on the palate and extend the finish nicely.
title: Barra of Mendocino 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Light and subtle yet distinct aromas of pineapple meet with crushed white rocks on the nose of this bottling. Pineapple juice flavors also arise on the palate, with is lean and crisp with touches of ripe lemon and pear flesh.
title: Zaca Mesa 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Seared lemon peels, densely packed honeysuckle, Brie rind and white-ash aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend from the regional superstars, which recently became part of the Jackson Family of wines. The palate is tightly wound with grapefruit pith and a lemon spray-laced acidity that provides ample structure, carrying the slightest bit of riper stone fruit at the core.
title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Light, fresh and yet slightly rich on the nose, this bottling shows aromas of white flower, Asian pear and lemon-laced crème brûlée. There is strong grip to the sip, with tight lime peel and pith flavors as well as hints of white peach flesh and honeysuckle. Roasted nuts arise on the finish.
title: Tantara 2015 Zotovich Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Buttercream, sweet butter, marmalade, baking spice, brown sugar and sea salt converge on the nose of this bottling, named after the Foley family's Texas ranches. Sea salt, vanilla, lemon peel and frozen-butter flavors show on the sip, which is fatter in the midpalate but cut by the savory saltiness.
title: Foley 2015 T Anchor Ranch Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The nose on this bottling leans a bit sweet yet remains zesty, with ripe apples, pears, lime sorbet and lemon-lime soda. But the sip is racy and sizzling with buoyant acidity, delivering tightly wound Bosc pear and Gravenstein apple flavors doused with citrus spray.
title: Coquelicot 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Los Olivos District)

description: This estate-grown wine is exuberantly lemony and floral on the nose while the palate boasts lush, concentrated flavors of honey, oak, vanilla and baked pear. Full bodied, it wears its oak well, allowing it to speak in tandem with the ripe fruit.
title: Hess 2015 The Lioness Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: From an estate site, this wine offers power and concentration. Creamy in texture, the generosity of fruit is balanced by notes of stone, toasted oak and French butter, making for a wonderfully complete experience on the palate.
title: La Crema 2015 Kelli Ann Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made entirely from Dijon clones to emphasize the fruit from this site, this wine is voluptuous in style, with a backbone of caramelized apple and pear flavor. Fig and quince contribute secondary characteristics of rounded richness, as a bite of salty lime marks the finish.
title: Tamber Bey 2015 Deux Chevaux Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: Inviting aromas of honeysuckle make way for an unctuous, voluptuous palate of smooth, ripe apple, fig and pear flavors in this vineyard designate. Full-bodied and concentrated in style, it has a high-toned hint of lemon zest that peaks on the finish.
title: Lynmar 2015 Sweeney Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: From a winery started in 1973, this is an excellent Chardonnay. Vibrant almond and macadamia nut mesh with guava, peach and melon notes on the nose. A clean line of citrusy acidity dissects the palate, cutting into ripe stone fruit and touches of smoke and oak to yield a mouthwatering finish.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: The aromas are restrained and mellow in this bottling from winemaker Tyler Thomas, showing mostly yellow apple and citrus peel notes. The palate is racy, high-toned and steely in structure, framed by a razor-sharp edge of zippy acidity, with only faint background notes of ripe stonefruit.
title: Dierberg 2014 Dierberg Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: For this wine, grapes are sourced from cooler sites within the valley, as well as from a high-elevation site on Mount Veeder. Together, they provide a juicy, fleshy core of apple and pear girded by mineral-laden texture and tension. The finish is marked by oak-derived toast and brioche notes.
title: Chappellet 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This bottling from a vineyard northwest of the Sta. Rita Hills opens with buttercream, lemon peel, lime spritz and toasted almond scents. The buttery quality extends to the full but energetic palate, where it's cut by lemon marmalade, savory smoke and toast notes. The finish is nutty.
title: Cebada 2013 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This wine from the sought-after site opens with spice, salty brine and a light imprint of acidity. It shows prominent preserved lemon and crisp green apple notes, as well as more developed layers of peach. The oak is well integrated and helpful to the whole, adding texture and weight.
title: Migration 2015 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This fine, small-production wine is fermented and aged predominantly in concrete egg-the better to preserve and promote its beautifully crisp, briny green-apple and pear flavors. Its sharp acidity acts as a squeeze of lemon, making it all the more satisfying.
title: Gary Farrell 2015 Rochioli-Allen Vineyards Clone 76 Concrete Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A block selection from the producer's expertly farmed estate in Carneros, this is a robust, ripe white that's velvety rich on the palate and laced with apple and melon flavors. A tart, salty note laps at its edges.
title: Artesa 2015 Block 92 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Shows its cool coastal origin in the crisp acidity and lean, Chablisian profile. Underneath the smoky oak is a very dry, mineral-infused wine with citrus and wildflower flavors. Could develop over the next six years.
title: Pfendler 2007 Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a fair price to pay for a wine of this pedigree. The vineyard is owned by Talley, and the wine shows the brilliant acidity and fruit of Edna Valley. Massive and complex in grilled pineapples, ripe kiwis, butter, vanilla, spices and smoky oak.
title: Stephen Ross 2007 Oliver's Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Always a precise, focused wine, Alma Rosa's '07 El Jabalí shows a procession toward a drier, more Chablis-style Chardonnay than in the past. It's mouthwatering in acidity, with firm flavors of chalky minerals, pineapples, honeysuckle flowers and buttered toast. Now-2012.
title: Alma Rosa 2007 El Jabalí Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A first-rate Chardonnay reminiscent of a fine French Chablis. Ultra-dry and steely, with mouthwatering acidity framing flavors of Meyer lemon, lime, lychee and minerals. Oak is there, in the background, providing hints of butter and toast.
title: Freemark Abbey 2007 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Comes down on the opposite side of the spectrum from the opulent 2006, a bone-dry, acidic young Chardonnay marked more by minerals than fruit. With citrus, papaya and floral notes and a tang of cold steel, it has a leesy yeastiness that adds complex interest. Compelling, and possibly ageworthy.
title: Suacci Carciere Wines 2007 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Strikes an interesting balance between richness and austerity. Will fascinate true connoisseurs for its mineral-laden suggestions of dried lemons and kaffir limes, and the way sweet oak elaborates them. Crisp acidity provides the final balance of mouthwatering tartness. A true Chablis-style Chardonnay, at a fair price.
title: Bedarra 2007 Reserve Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Shows the savory acidity and fresh, pure flavors that inevitably mark white wines from this little appellation, which lies between the Santa Lucia Highlands and the broad plain of the Salinas Valley. Dry and tart, it's rich in lemon, lime, fig, buttered toast and cinnamon spice flavors.
title: Joullian 2007 RogerRose Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Super-drinkable for its creamy texture, touch of sour lees, sweet oaky buttered toast, crisp acidity and ripe blast of pineapples, Asian pears, green apples and peppery spices. Perfect for the table with salmon, pork and chicken.
title: De Loach 2007 O.F.S. Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A very nice Chardonnay that satisfies for its richness and delicate structure. Silky and crisp, it shows flavors of pineapples, Mandarin oranges, vanilla custard, honeysuckle and stony minerals.
title: Acacia 2007 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Marked by extreme dryness, acidity, minerality, floral notes and lemon-peel tartness, this is a Chablis-style Chardonnay. It's quite elegantly structured, if not particularly opulent. An intellectual wine. Now-2012.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2006 Portola Springs Vineyard Estate Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A lovely Chardonnay, softly creamy and lilting, with opulent flavors of pineapples, sweet lemon custard, buttered toast, vanilla, honey and smoke. Great with lobster.
title: Qupé 2007 Bien Nacido Reserve Block Eleven Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Bone dry, minerally and floral, this Chardonnay has lemondrop flavors subtlely enriched with spicy oak. It's a streamlined, elegant wine, crisply acidic and moderately ageworthy. Now through 2012.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2006 Allbutom Vineyard Estate Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: There's a lot of oak on this Chard, sourced from multiple vineyards, and the barrel influences currently dominate, with the vanilla, butterscotch and caramel flavors many people confuse with the taste of Chardonnay itself. In this case, the underlying pineapple, pear and green apple fruit is ample enough to support all that weight.
title: Ferrari-Carano 2007 Tré Terre Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in a softly flamboyant style, with massive flavors of citrus and tropical fruits, buttered toast, cinnamon and crème brûlée, firmed with stony minerals. Tons of stuffing in this opulent Chardonnay, which was aged in 50% new oak.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2007 Highlands Estates Piner Hills Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Tight, taut and lemony, a Chablis-like Chardonnay of extreme dryness and minerality. Shows mouthwatering flavors of flint, Meyer lemons and limes, with a touch of smoky oak. Very fine and elegant, a beautiful Chardonnay that will support, not overwhelm, food.
title: Keenan 2007 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)

description: Ripe, lush and immediately attractive, this Chard offers rich tiers of pineapple custard, pear marmalade, vanilla, buttered toast, toasted coconut and Asian spice flavors. It's a strong, flamboyant wine that calls for equally strong foods, like lobster.
title: Barnett 2007 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Very ripe and Burgundian in the wealth of flamboyant pineapples, guavas, minerals, buttered toast, crème brûlée and vanilla, wrapped into a creamy, leesy texture. A bit unfocused now, and should be best by the Fall of 2009.
title: Viansa 2007 Cento per Cento Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: A very good wine that easily earns its score, but is not perfect. It's a bit on the fruity-sweet, one-dimensional side, with jammy pineapple and apricot flavors, enriched with sweet, smoky, vanilla-accented oak. Yet fine, firm coastal acidity provides needed balance.
title: Heintz 2007 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Achieves the difficult feat of tasting sweet but finishing dry. The pineapple custard, peach pie and butterscotch flavors are impossible to resist, yet the wine firms up on the finish, with a scour of dry acidity.
title: Maple Creek 2007 Estate Chardonnay (Yorkville Highlands)

description: Monterey's cool-climate flavors of lemons and limes marry richer, more tropical Santa Barbara notes in this creamy smooth Chardonnay. Oak plays a prominent role, lending an edge of vanilla and buttered toast. This is a very good price for the quality.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2007 Grand Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Barbara-Monterey)

description: Oak barrel aging provides sweet wood tannins and lush notes of vanilla and crème brûlée, but the real star of this wine is the fruit. It tastes of pineapples, mandarin oranges, green apples, kiwis, limes and Asian pears. Delicious and mouth-filling, and a bargain at this price.
title: Merryvale 2007 Starmont Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a very rich Chardonnay marked by creamy, leesy, butter and oak notes that give it an exotic sweetness. But it's bone-dry, and the underlying fruit is powerful enough to stand up to all that bling. Just delicious in pineapple, pear marmalade, crème brûlée and spice flavors.
title: Scott Family 2007 Estate Dijon Clone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: This Chard is a big step up from the winery's '05s. So rich and opulent, it's almost decadent, but is balanced with dryness, crisp acidity and a bracing minerality, like a tang of granite. Yet it's the flavors, of pineapples, peach pie, vanilla and cinnamon, that keep you coming back.
title: Zina Hyde Cunningham 2006 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: This is a gigantic Chardonnay. It dazzles with superripe, jammy pineapple, apricot, Meyer lemon and apple butter flavors, with creamy, spicy oak notes. Not particularly subtle, so drink it with big foods, like lobster and   scallops.
title: Tandem 2006 Porter-Bass Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a dense, full-bodied Chardonnay that needs time to come around. Thoroughly dry and oaky, with 40% new wood, it shows ripe, complex flavors of pineapple brûlée, pears and apricots. Yet there's an immature sappy, jammy quality, characteristic of a young Chardonnay. Give it until early or mid-2009, when it should be gorgeous.
title: Lynmar 2006 Quail Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A broad structure of acids, oak tannins and minerals gives this wine the architecture to stand up to its vast richness. Exotic and powerful, it offers a blast of green apples, pineapples and mangoes, with a doughnut sweetness of vanilla and cinnamon.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2006 Dutton Ranch Rued Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Morgan has been a real pioneer in the unoaked Chardonnay movement, and when the wine scores, it scores big. Consider this a run-scoring triple. It's totally dry, very acidic (officially, 7.13 g/L, for the statistically-minded) and austere, with a hard edge of minerals. What fruit there is suggests tart green apples and white nectarines. Believe me, you won't miss the oak.
title: Morgan 2007 Metallico Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Structure, minerals and lees mark this elegant Chardonnay. You'll find ripe pear and tropical fruits that taste like they were baked into a pie, but ripe fruit is easy to achieve these days. It's the architectural integrity that makes this wine so fine.
title: Dutton Estate 2006 Dutton Ranch Kyndall's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a classy Chardonnay. Grown 1,200 feet above Calistoga and fairly well-oaked in new barrels, it's rich and complex, with flavors of grilled tropical fruits and toasted meringue. The structure is greatly improved by a crisp, minerally edge of acidity.
title: Cali 351 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Acidity, hardness and steel always characterize this intensely dry Chardonnay, made in perhaps the coolest corner of Russian River Valley. The '06 is minerally, angular and austere. Call it Chablisian. With jangly acidity, it's relieved by peach, green apple and Meyer lemon flavors.  Enormously elegant. Drink now through 2012.
title: Iron Horse 2006 Corral Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: A fine wine that shows the classic structure of Russian River Chardonnay, and also a steely minerality that makes it a partner for food. That doesn't mean it's without fruit. The flavors of apricots, pears and more exotic tropical fruits are explosive, enhanced with smoky oak. Likely to develop bottle complexity over the next four years.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2006 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The vineyard is in the cool, southwesterly Green Valley, and the wine shows brilliant acidity and tangy green apple flavors, enriched with spicy, smoky new oak. It's a forward, rather pushy Chardonnay, insistent in its New World assertiveness, but an enormously attractive one that calls for equally big foods, like lobster, or scallops in a coconut-curry sauce.
title: Nickel & Nickel 2006 Medina Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The label says Napa Valley but the grapes come from Carneros, and you can taste the cool fog in the crisp acidity that frames long hangtime flavors of ripe pineapple, guava, nectarine, roasted peach and lime custard. This is a pretty Chard, balanced and dry, and it impresses for its volume and length.
title: Salexis 2004 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: A fine Chardonnay, marked by crisp, citrusy acidity that cleanses the mouth and makes the wine so refreshing. Flavorwise, it's a powerhouse, with pear, green apple, lemon meringue, buttered toast and smoky, vanilla flavors that finish in a swirl of cloves and pepper.
title: Gary Farrell 2006 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Iron Horse's estate Chard is a remarkably consistent wine. Never overoaked, superripe or heavy, it always has an elegant minerality. The '06, from a coolish vintage, is flavored with green apples, Meyer lemons and Bosc pears.
title: Iron Horse 2006 Estate Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Richly oaked, fantastically ripe in long hangtime fruit, this Chard has exotic flavors of golden mangoes, nectarines, passionfruit, pineapple jam and kiwis. Oak adds extra layers of buttered toast, crème brûlée and smoky vanilla. For all the honeyed sweetness, it's totally dry, a tour de force that's at its best now.
title: Logan 2006 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: There's something tight and minerally and acidic about this Chardonnay that will appeal to connoisseurs of austere wines. Even though the oak is nearly one-half new, the wine has a lean, lemony taste, with nuances of crème brûlée and roasted hazelnuts. Defines food-friendly elegance, and could develop bottle complexity over the next 5 years.
title: Merryvale 2005 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Comes down on the lean, hard, Chablis-like side of Chardonnay, with a steely spine of minerals and tangy acidity. This provides an elegant infrastructure to the subtle pineapple, green apple and lime zest flavors.
title: De Loach 2006 Porter Bass Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is the winery's bells and whistles Chardonnay. Grown from inland fruit, in a vineyard near Ukiah, it's rich in buttercreamy peach, pear and pineapple flavors, with a spicy, racy finish.
title: Standish 2006 Watson Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Strikes a nice balance between heavily oaked and unoaked Chards by being aged in older, neutral oak. As a result, the inherently fine quality of the wine shows through with just a touch of smoke and wood. Crisp and minerally, with a flinty, gunmetal taste, the wine's fruit flatters the palate with pineapples, pears and even tropical fruits, especially mango.
title: Amista 2005 Morningsong Vineyards Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Made in the Sleepy Hollow style, extraordinarily ripe, almost botrytized in apricot and honey flavors like a dessert wine, except that it's bone dry. Really epitomizes this vineyard and corner of Monterey, where Chard ripens to beautifully while maintaining acidity.
title: Testarossa 2006 Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Simi winemaker Steve Reeder has produced an utterly delicious wine with this barrel-fermented beauty, the best nonreserve Chard from the winery in nearly 10 years. It shows flamboyant, complex flavors of tropical fruits, green apples, pears, butterscotch and smoky vanilla, with crisp, clean Russian River acidity. This is a good price, and the wine should be easy to find, with nearly 20,000 cases produced.
title: Simi 2005 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Lush enough to drink now, with decanting, but this powerfully ripe Chard will benefit from limited aging. It's explosive in oak-infused pineapple, papaya, peach, green apple and Asian spice flavors, but right now the oak is not integrated with the fruit, making for a disjointed quality. Give it until mid-2008, and for a couple years after.
title: Lynmar 2005 Quail Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is the winery's big, barrel-fermented Chard. Even under all that creamy, smoky oak and leesy richness, those Edna Valley acids shine through, making the lime, kiwi and pineapple flavors bright, and leading to a zingy, crisp finish.
title: Tolosa 2005 1772 Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Those familiar with Morgan's more expensive Chardonnays, such as the Double L (which comprises 55% of this blend) will find true value in this regional wine. It shows similar power and authority in a showy, Chablis-style wine whose acidic, minerally structure frames intense citrus and oak flavors.
title: Morgan 2006 Highland Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is one of the biggest, richest Chardonnays that Rodney Strong has ever produced, and no wonder, as longtime winemaker Rick Sayre was assisted by David Ramey as a consultant. The wine has Ramey-esque proportions, gigantic in fleshy tropical fruit, caramel, vanilla cream, butterscotch and meringue flavors. It's so softly decadent, it's almost better as a cocktail wine than with food.
title: Rodney Strong 2005 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: An interesting and complex Chard marked by intense minerality. Calls to mind Chablis in the acidity, dryness and racy taste of cold steel. Also in the flavor mix are tart green apples, pineapples, limes, cinnamon spice and creamy lees.
title: Gallo Family Vineyards 2004 Laguna Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Always an interesting wine, Talbott's '03 Diamond T is so distinctive, it's almost eccentric. The candied apricots and cinnamon flavors have a baked pie-filling taste. With high acidity and a minerally edge, this Chard will develop nutty complexities over the next three to five years.
title: Talbott 2003 Diamond T Estate Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: An acidic, minerally Chardonnay  showing structure, cleanliness and elegance. Richness comes by way of intense limes, as well as the usual complexities of new oak and lees aging, and there is not the slightest suggestion of sweetness. This is a very pure, Zen-like expression of cool-climate California Chardonnay.
title: Marimar Estate 2005 Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The oak is sweet and upfront but well-proportioned to the size of the fruit in this luscious Chardonnay, which comes from a cooler part of Napa Valley. There's Carneros-like acidity and very ripe, forward pear, peach, pineapple and date nut bread flavors.
title: Dillon 2005 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: Give this youthful wine some time to settle down. Tasted in late March, its parts had yet to mesh. The acidity, oakiness and fresh grapy flavors are at some odds with each other. By winter of 2007, it should be a fine, complex Chardonnay, and drink well for five years.
title: Stephen Ross 2005 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Silky and crisp, with those long, penetrating Edna Valley flavors of ripe kiwis, Key lime pie and intense vanilla. Shows real elegance and flair, and this is a good price for the quality.
title: Stephen Ross 2005 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Very dry and a little earthy, with a dusty hay or dried straw quality to the tangerine, sweet lime, lychee, peaches and cream flavors. An interesting, crisp Chard with plenty of nuanced complexity.
title: Petroni 2005 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Iron Horse joins the unoaked Chard bandwagon with this dry, complex wine. Their estate grapes are so good, the wine doesn't even need all that wood. It's elaborately tailored in pineapple, mango, ripe white peach and spicebox flavors. The vanilla and smoke, which have got to come from the grapes, add extra deliciousness.
title: Iron Horse 2005 UnOaked Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: The â"˜04 is rich and savory in tropical fruit, apricot, butterscotch and vanilla flavors, with a dry, balanced finish.
title: Newton 2004 Unfiltered Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a great expression of what winemaker Randy Ullom calls the Santa Maria Bench. Full malolactic fermentation has softened the wine, while barrel fermentation adds to the honeyed, creamy texture. Yet there's enough acidity to balance the lush tropical fruit-pie filling, kumquat, pineapple, apricot, vanilla custard and buttered toast richness.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2005 Camelot Highlands Estate Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: From a great vineyard sourced by this producer for some time, this wine impresses in its sublime texture and integrated oak, the fruit profile of Gravenstein apple and pear is fleshy and lush. Bright acidity keeps the palate fresh and ready for more.
title: Patz & Hall 2016 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Smooth and stony in mineral elements, this is a complex, medium-bodied and structured white. It is well defined in bold flavors of green apple, melon and Meyer lemon.
title: Les Belles Collines 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made entirely from old Wente clone vines, this structured wine offers a steely core of lemon, green apple and honey. There's balanced acidity on the palate, with floral accents of apple and orange blossoms.
designation: Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard
title: Donum 2016 Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A robust entry of crisp acidity and lively pineapple fruit impresses immediately in this vineyard-designate that's well made and memorable. Rounded integrated oak gives it a pleasurable texture and length that's both complex and inviting.
title: Friedeman 2016 UV Lancel Creek Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a new wine from the producer's Westside Road property. Soft and approachable, it has crisp, steely acidity that carries flavors of wet stone and lemon peel. It takes on a broader sense of lushness as it opens on the midpalate, presenting bold flavors of peach and apricot.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Williams Selyem Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Fresh Meyer lemon peel and lime are drizzled atop pear brioche, nut cream and oak on the nose of this expressive, fresh bottling from an Ojai-based winery. It's tightly wound on the palate with fresh honeysuckle and light white peach flavors, finishing with a chalky grip.
title: Topa Mountain Winery 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Salty, briny oak gives a lift to the bolder richer flavors of baked pear in this lovely vineyard-designate, made in small amounts. Caramel and vanilla accent a nicely lush, yet balanced palate of full flavor and grace.
title: Saxon Brown 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is an integrated, well-made white, with juicy acidity and a robust ripeness. Grainy apple, pear and lemon flavors provide texture as additional accents of nutmeg, lemongrass and tea intrigue.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Allen Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a thick, intense and boldly concentrated wine, balanced in its richness by supportive acidity. Gravenstein apple flavors are nearly baked in flavor, with bolts of nutmeg and cinnamon adding intrigue and complexity.
title: Patz & Hall 2016 Zio Tony Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an exceptionally well-made wine at the price point: floral and appealing in quiet waves of citrus, baked pear and nutmeg. Integrated oak gives it power and strength within an edge of mineral-laden acidity.
title: La Crema 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The 25% new French oak shows in luxurious ways on this bottling, with aromas of butterscotch, scorched hazelnuts, pecans and a backdrop of seashell minerality on the nose. Warm nutty flavors consume the palate, yet there's a grapefruit-rind edge as well.
title: Eden Rift 2016 Terraces Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)

description: Lime skins, grapefruit, ash, lily, chives and dairy aromas make for a unique and dynamic entry to the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high in the mountains near Chalone. There's a grainy tightness to the palate, where Meyer lemon pith, almond oil and herbal elements battle for attention.
title: Big Basin 2016 Coastview Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: From a vineyard that's one of this appellation's closest to the Monterey Bay, this bottling is tightly woven on the nose with lime pith, chalk, Meyer lemon, lily and a hint of apple flesh aromas. It's very taut on the palate, with honeysuckle, apple blossom and Key lime pie flavors.
title: Scheid 2016 Escolle Road Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Layered in crunchy apple and cinnamon, with an underlying richness of pie dough, this is a well-integrated and highly likable white. Oak does its job quietly and with purpose, as a mineral component of crushed rock provides an exotic edge to the finish.
title: The Calling 2015 Sullivan Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Exotic and floral, this has a substantial midpalate of powerful concentration, exhibited as big flavors of apple, pear and lemon. Lightly ripe, it has texture and nuance that are impressively lengthy and delicious.
title: La Follette 2016 Sangiacomo Green Acres Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This lovely, well-made white is spicy, grippy and textured, with robust underlying richness. Light in style, the mouthfeel is balanced in juicy, lingering acidity and quiet flavors of green apple and lime.
title: Coursey Graves 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is winemaker Jim Clendenen's take on the region's most important vineyard. It is light in the glass yet with savory aromas of chalk, butter, hazelnut and sandalwood. Rounded flavors of lemon, honeydew and orange cream lead into a caramelized finish.
title: Au Bon Climat 2016 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is such a lovely white wine, priced attractively, which delivers a heady entry of honey and caramelized oak. Juicy acidity lifts bold flavors of lemon meringue, green apple and tangerine, finishing with a balanced weight and intrigue of nutmeg.
title: RouteStock 2017 Route 121 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This bottling by Ian Brand always packs bang for the buck, but he really nailed it in the 2017 vintage. Clean and delicate aromas of Asian pear, lemon rind and edgy chalk lead into a racy, crisp and tightly wound palate. Flavors of grapefruit, nectarine, blanched almond and sea salt are delicious.
title: Le P'tit Paysan 2017 Jacks Hill Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: This is the brand new project from Alex Gambal and Peter Work of Ampelos Cellars in the Sta. Rita Hills, where Gambal is hoping to replicate his Burgundian style. This wine's rounded aromas of white peach, sea salt caramel and nectarine syrup lead into an energetic palate that's sharply citrus at first before the chalky minerality takes hold.
title: Gambal + Work 2016 Francesca Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Creamy and lushly full bodied, this wine is complemented by a gritty texture of mineral and crushed rock, the whole integrated and well structured. Bold ripe flavors of pear are met by baking spice and toasted oak that linger with abandon on the finish.
title: Entrepreneur 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Harmonious and beautifully integrated, this supple and flavorful wine feels seamless and tastes rich, complex and complete. The palate subtly combines flavors of ripe apple and pear with hints of honey, butter and vanilla.
title: Bee Hunter 2016 Mariah Vineyards Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Nutty aromas of walnut and hazelnut meet with sandalwood and a cream pudding touch on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong citrus pith tension to the palate alongside the roasted nut flavor, and the finish is waxy in texture.
title: Neely 2016 Home Block Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A deep gold color and effusive aromas of dough, toast and butter start this wine off with a bang. The flavors are rich, vivid and nicely oaky, giving up butterscotch, toast and lemon curd along with softer vanilla and pear tones. It is generous and rich in texture.
title: Domaine Anderson 2015 Walraven Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Full, fleshy and complex, this is a beautifully layered and nuanced wine, well integrated with a bite of acidity and grip. Peach, pear and anise all play a part in bringing it to life, allowing room for further development in the glass.
title: Patz & Hall 2016 Hudson Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: From 38-year-old vines on the northern limits of the appellation near Portola Valley, his bottling offers sunshine-loaded aromas of cooked lemons, yellow peach and damp wood. The palate is broad and strong with flavors of sandalwood, roasted apples and toast with preserved lemon spread.
title: Neely 2016 Bee Block Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This reserve white is tangled in tones of brioche and crème brûlée, with a bright shock of lively acidity that supports an underlying cradle of toasted oak. Stone, quince and a spark of lemon meringue add intrigue to the midpalate. Best 2020-2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard
title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Like its bigger Mount Eden sister, this more affordable, usually more immediately accessible bottling needs time to open up. With patience, aromas of honeysuckle, oak and nuts provide a savory impression. The palate combines grapefruit pith and Meyer lemon rinds with savory salt and nuts.
title: Domaine Eden 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: There is a strong woody touch to the nose of this bottling along with dried peach and dried mango aromas. The palate begins with a strong citrus-peel flavor then leads into green-pear and cider-apple flavors. The finish is a unique touch of kaffir lime leaf and lemongrass, which would go well with a wide variety of food.
title: Matias Wines 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Lemon syrup, toasty sandalwood, dried mango and nectarine show on the nose of this bottling from vines planted in 2007. The palate pairs squeezed lemon, guava and mango-cream flavors with a hint of oak and decent acid, finishing with a waxy texture.
title: Tantara 2016 Tondre Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Toasty aromas of seared lemon, citrus pith and ashy Brie rind show on the nose of this bottling from the longtime grape-growing family. The palate is extremely focused and sharp, offering lime sorbet, green pear and more pithy qualities, wrapped in a compellingly grippy texture.
title: Melville 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Strong flavors of lemon, lime and salty oak permeate the opening of this dense concentrated wine, which retains moderate acidity and freshness. The brightness comes from a lingering sensation of wet stone and citrus that intrigues.
title: Della 2016 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Bright and fresh in Gravenstein apple, fig and citrus flavors, this full-bodied wine is balanced and well integrated, with a depth of texture and complexity. It lingers gingerly in Asian spice.
title: MacRostie 2016 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This single-vineyard expression is loaded on the nose with brioche aromas alongside Meyer lemon preserves and a hint of apple cream. The palate is full in that California way, but balanced deftly, combining toast, oak, cashew and tangy lemon-curd flavors.
title: Bernardus 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Lush round flavors of pear, melon and salted rocky minerality work well together in this well-made estate wine. With integrated oak, it offers a soft smooth palate of balanced richness.
title: Schug 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Brioche and almond flavors meet a sleek, smooth and tightly focused core in this meticulously made white. Apple, pear and lemon meringue provide complexity on the midpalate before finishing crisp and slightly spicy.
title: Fort Ross Winery 2016 Sea Slopes Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Butterscotch and hazelnut aromas make for a very creamy and yet not overblown nose on this bottling. It's zesty on the palate with strong lime and lemon-rind flavors, yet the core remains the clarified butter, hazelnut and cashew flavors, leading into a crème brûlée finish.
title: Bernardus 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Brioche, honey and matchstick open the door to lush, voluptuous and full-bodied layers of flavor and tension in this bold wine. Toasted, integrated oak accents the rich fruit.
title: Flanagan 2016 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: From a dry-farmed site and older vines, this wine is resplendent in white flowers, salty brine and strong flavors of melon, pineapple and sweet vanilla. With a soft integrated texture and toasted oak, crème brûlée and burnt sugar.
title: Arista 2015 Banfield Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Golden apples, lime zest and lemon blossoms show strongly on the sunny nose of this bottling. The palate offers a tangy lemon-lime acidity and a chalky texture, proving racy and almost spicy with citrusy acidity.
title: Roar 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Slightly reduced and with a robust flavor of toast, this wine offers steely acidity beneath its core of apple-led fruit, remaining balanced and complex in the glass. Lasting elements of anise and lemongrass tease on the finish.
title: Newton 2015 Unfiltered Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This appellation blend starts with a rich, inviting and impressively layered nose, showing singed Meyer lemon rinds, roasted nuts and crème brûlée, but also a refreshing touch of honeysuckle. The palate is framed by fresh lemon spray that gives vibrancy to the chalky palate, which also offers creamy butter richness.
title: Cinnabar 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: There is a lot of pent-up energy on the nose of this fresh and zesty bottling, which shows aromas of key lime, tangerine, wet stone and a hint of nectarine. The palate is overloaded with citrusy flavors, from Meyer lemon peel to grapefruit pith, but there is also baked-apple warmth at its core.
title: Dierberg 2015 Dierberg Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: There's a strong flinty note to the nose of this bottling, which meshes with smoked apple and dried lemon-peel aromas. The palate is wound up tight, and the smoke and flint show again, but fall in line behind the nectarine, white peach and lime zest flavors.
title: Baileyana 2016 Firepeak Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: The third release of this celebration of the Sonoma Coast, sourced from Gap's Crown Vineyard in the Petaluma Gap, this imparts lemon curd and apple skin in a robust body of concentrated richness and rounded texture. Tart, fresh and focused acidity balances the wine's larger-than-life tendencies.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2015 Le Seul Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light, delicate and lovely on the nose, this single-vineyard expression offers fresh and clean aromas of light pear and lemon rind. The palate picks up toast and toasted nut flavors, with rounded pear flesh, honeysuckle and tangy tangerine rinds as the backdrop.
title: Windstream 2014 Sarmento Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Named Dobles Lías because it is given extended lees contact to add richness and texture, this wine impresses in its heady tones of honey and brioche. Tropical pineapple and a touch of brine give it a complementary yin-yang spirit that works.
designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Dobles Lías Estate Grown Estate Bottled Unfiltered
title: Marimar Estate 2015 Don Miguel Vineyard Dobles Lías Estate Grown Estate Bottled Unfiltered Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Light in color, this bottling of the Wente clone from a historic, wind-whipped, hilltop vineyard shows soft aromas of white peach, creamy melon and key lime, all dusted by ample sea salt. The palate starts with a touch of toast and caramel, but then grabs the palate with a grippy texture and flavors of lemon and lime juice.
title: Rusack 2016 Mt. Carmel Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There's a note of barrel influence on the nose, a heartiness of oak that weaves within the greater whole as the wine develops. Smooth, rounded richness, a mix of baked apple and hazelnut, provide a textured balance of flavor within lovely highlights of lemongrass and ginger.
title: Hanzell 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: Tempting toast and fresh bread aromas lead to layers of lemon, butter, crisp apple and baking-spice flavors in this nicely complex, compact and well-balanced wine from a three-year-old urban winery in Berkeley. It is medium bodied, feels lively but smooth on the palate and has aged-on-the-lees complexity and richness.
title: Windchaser 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: From one of the country's first bicoastal wineries, the Virginia-cum-California is off to a strong start with this wine from John Sebastiano and La Rinconada vineyards. Aromas of lemon curd, sweet cream and lime pith are soft yet attention-grabbing. The palate is clean, crisp and tightly woven with tangy citrus flavors and great textural grip.
title: Paradise Springs 2015 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Tart, focused and bright in acidity, this unoaked wine doesn't hold back in richness, allowing the fruit to speak freely for itself in lemon, Mandarin orange and melon. Asian pear and peach play supporting roles as lingering aromas of jasmine weigh in.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Creamy and lush, with warmth of baked pear and fig, this wine fully embraces a ripe fleshy style and does it justice. Supportive, integrated oak adds to the full-bodied voluptuousness as jolts of acidity settle things down and make the wine complex in underlying freshness.
title: Croix 2015 Narrow Gauge Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: A blend of the historic Sierra Madre and Bien Nacido vineyards, this reserve wine shows toasted hazelnut, seared lemon rind, salted apricot and a touch of sour cream on the tangy yet smoky nose. A sharp sandalwood flavors comes through on the sip, along with poached apple, buttered toast and sea salt. It needs a touch more time to come together.
title: Rusack 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Subtle aromas of white peach flesh, crushed limestone and nectarine blossom decorate the nose of this estate bottling from a pioneering family. The palate is loaded with flint, smoke and a plaster of Paris element in the background, all giving depth to the nectarine cream, key lime spritz and hint of chive flavors.
title: Beauregard 2016 Beauregard Ranch Chardonnay (Ben Lomond Mountain)

description: An enticing aroma of toasted oak meets spicy ripe peach and pear flavors in this full-bodied luxuriously creamy wine. It has vanilla, nutmeg and ginger notes and a mouth-coating texture that is also well supported by acidity. Oaky, yes; delicious and balanced, also yes.
title: Shannon 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Red Hills)

description: Flavorful and rich in texture, this generous and full-bodied wine presents a rather light, toasty aroma. Ripe, concentrated fruit and oak flavors are carried on a plush texture that coats the palate with vanilla, baking spice and ripe pear that linger on the finish.
title: Poseidon 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This shows the ripe tropical fruit of a fine vintage, yet maintains the keen citrusy acidity that makes this vineyard's Chards so balanced and ageworthy. Beneath the pineapple marmalade, apricot and caramelly oak flavors is a rich, flinty minerality that cries out for lobster.
title: Mer Soleil 2004 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: . If you're familiar with the lush, complex Chards from Robert Young, this will ring a bell. It's layered in ripe mango, guava, nectarine, peach and smoky, caramelized oak flavors, with an exotic taste of butter-sautéed bananas. All that flavor is nicely balanced by rich, lemony acidity.
title: Stuhlmuller Vineyards 2005 Estate Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Here's a seriously good Chardonnay that fruit lovers will covet, but it's also enormously oaky. I like all that new French wood because the caramelly, smoky vanilla and buttered toast, which is boosted by total malolactic fermentation, works so well with the mangoes, papayas and pineapples. But I know people who would call this Chard toothpicky.
title: Merryvale 2004 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This Chard, Vine Cliff's reserve, is actually less immediately rich and opulent than the regular, released last Spring, which was a very elaborate wine. This one may not be ready to drink quite yet. It's tight and spicy, with a leesy, minerally streak and lots of oak. Hold through 2007, then drink for a few more years.
title: Vine Cliff 2004 Proprietress Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a new bottling from Morgan, a junior version of their great Hat Trick Chardonnay. Most of the grapes come from the winery's Double L estate. The wine is bone dry, high in acidity, and compellingly complex. The dryness makes the lime zest and kiwi flavors star on their own, while new French oak adds a gorgeous layer of toasty cream.
title: Morgan 2005 Highland Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Plenty of richness here, mangoes, pineapple custard, Key lime pie, not to mention smoky, caramelly, butterscotchy oak, but there's also a streamlined, sleek minerality that leaves a lip-smacking steely feeling behind. Part of that is acidity. Really fine wine.
title: Steele 2004 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Super-ripe, superoaky, and while these are potential pitfalls, Testarossa handles them with aplomb. The flavors really impress, offering a detonation of creamy, smoky oak and imposingly rich pineapple custard and crème brûlée. It's all balanced by zesty acidity. Drink this flashy Chardonnay now.
title: Testarossa 2004 Brosseau Vineyard Chardonnay (Chalone)

description: This is a new winery for me, and it's produced quite an impressive wine. It's big, thick, mouth-filling, with creamy pineapple custard and spice flavors and a firm, acidic minerality that is clearly a function of terroir. Impresses not only for power but finesse.
title: Pendleton 2004 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: There aren't a lot of wines coming off this appellation, and most of them are red. But this is a wonderful Chard. Ripe and detailed, it combines tropical fruit, mineral and oak flavors, and is dry and tart in acids. This is one of the few California Chardonnays I would age for up to ten years.
title: Steele 2004 Du Pratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)

description: The vineyard is in the Green Valley, and the acidity is very high, giving a bright purity to the kiwi, Key lime pie, pineapple custard and crème brûlée flavors. Lots of toasty new French oak and lees bring super creaminess to the mouthfeel. White Burgundy is the model, expressed California-style.
title: Armida 2004 Keefer Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Chards are tight, acidic and minerally in youth, showing a lees-infused structure but offering waves of complexity. With toasty oak, the base flavors are of nectarines, mangoes, peaches, zesty green apples and dustings of Asian spice.
title: Marimar Estate 2003 Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Well oaked, with a toasty, vanilla-infused cream and caramel edge, this polished Chard has peach custard flavors dusted with cinnamon, nutmeg and candied ginger. It's delicious and complex. The word "rich" doesn't begin to do it justice.
title: Mi Sueño 2004 Pugash Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: It's a mystery how, in such a hot vintage, Talley produced this dry, minerally, almost austere Chardonnay. When everyone else was getting mangoes, this wine shows flint along with lime zest and kiwi. Yet the mark of Rincon Chard always has been a steely stoniness. The oak regime is big, but the wine handles it with aplomb. Best now through 2008.
title: Talley 2004 Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: A distinctive Chardonnay made in the Farrell style, which leans toward acidic and elegant. But this is not an austere wine, far from it. It has a rich minerality and flavors of lime and pineapple custard, and then an even richer crème brûlée finish. Delicious and complex.
title: Gary Farrell 2004 Cresta Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: For decades Hanzell has been making one of California's most (and only) ageworthy Chards. The '03 is one for the cellar, but it comes at the price of being hard in youth. Starts out flinty and tannic, although as it airs, new oak and pineapple emerge. This seems like a very good Hanzell. Best 2009-2015.
title: Hanzell 2003 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: You can't smell acidity, but you can smell fruit so bright, it has to be high in acidity. This Chard is rewardingly pure and sharp in Key lime pie, papaya purée, fresh juicy tangerine and smoky, vanilla-infused oak flavors, and it grows more interesting with every sip.
title: Lafond 2004 SRH Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Napa-based Fisher has a new Chardonnay vineyard in Sonoma, 1,300 feet up, and these Dijon clones have produced an intense wine. The grapes were picked very ripe, and the wine is huge in pear and crème brûlée flavors, with zesty acidity. Impressive for its size and interest. You keep reaching for another glass.
title: Fisher 2004 Mountain Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Here's a big, rich, mouthfilling Chard. It's superoaky, superripe and just delicious, offering up a wealth of mango, guava, pineapple custard and peach pie fruit, with the crème brûlée, buttercream and buttered toast from new oak. Really good Chardonnay.
title: Medlock Ames 2004 Bell Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: This Chard showcases the Hills' wonderful mélange of ripe tropical and citrus fruit and crisp acidity. Add to that the complex toast and vanillins of the barrel, and the result is eminently drinkable. Enjoy this unctuous Chardonnay early before that babyfat melts away.
title: Brewer-Clifton 2004 Clos Pepe Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There's a rich streak of mineral that undergirds tremendous ripe tropical fruit, along with crisp acidity and a good amount of smoky oak that's perfectly integrated with the rich fruit. Tremendous extract and weight and a long, impressive finish make this wine addictively good.
title: Tantara 2004 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This enormously ripe wine shines with a purity of tropical fruit and candied citrus flavors that are generously oaked. But for all the richness, a penetrating acidity cuts through and makes the wine finish clean. Drink this Burgundian-style Chardonnay soon for its youthful opulence.
title: Ojai 2004 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The winery's reserve Chard has a richly satisfying buttercream texture that frames ripe flavors of limes, peaches and pinepapples, ending in a spicy, honeyed finish. Crisp acidity makes the wine bright and clean.
title: Domaine Alfred 2004 Chamisal Vineyards Califa Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Dobles lías, "double lees," tells you this is a leesy wine, and that slight sour-creamy flavor dominates. This is a wine you love or don't. I find it refreshingly dry and complex, not a fruit bomb, but a dry, elegant Chard, in which new French oak adds enriching notes.
